dictionary.meaning: A.H. is an acronym for After Hijrah. It is the reference used in the Islamic calender, instead of A.D. which is used in the Christian calender.
dictionary.more:
The year 2006 is 1427 in the Islamic calendar.
The Arabic acronym for A.H. is the letter 'ha' alone. When an Arabic speaker mentions an Islamic date they say, for example, 1427 Hijri or 1427 Ba'd al-Hijrah.

dictionary.meaning: The acronym AS is usually displayed in brackets (AS). It stands for the Arabic phrase "Alayhi-Salam", which translates to Peace Be Upon Him. The acronym is written after the names of Prophets and holy Imams as a sign of respect and reverence.
dictionary.more:
Prophet Muhammed usually has the acronym (SAW) after his name, and this is specific to him.
The Arabic form of the acronym is (ع) and stands for عليه السلام.

dictionary.meaning: The acronym (LA) is short for "La'natullahi 'Alayh" or "La'anahullah" (singular) or "La'natullahi 'alayhim" (plural). This phrase translates to "May Allah Curse Him/Them". A la'nah is a type of prayer (dua) to God to distance a person or persons from His mercy and enter them into hell.
dictionary.more: The Arabic show is for La'anahullah.

dictionary.meaning: The PBUH acronym stands for Peace Be Upon Him/Her. It is the English version of (AS). It is usually written after the name of a Prophet.
PBUT is an acronym that means Peace Be Upon Them. It is the plural version of (PBUH).

This acronym stands for Radhiallah 'Anh (singular masculine), Radhiallah 'Anha (singular feminine) or Radhiallah 'Anhum (plural) - May Allah be pleased with him/her/them. The acronym (RA) is used after mentioning the name of a companion or wife of the Prophet Muhammed like this: Umm Salamah (RA).
dictionary.more: The Arabic word shown is the plural form.

dictionary.meaning:
The acronym (SAW) is found in various forms such as (SA), (SAWA) or (SAWAW). 
The acronym (SAW) stands for "Sallalahu Alaihi Wa-salam" - May God's praise and peace be upon him. This acronym is used after mentioning the name of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) specifically, and shows respect and reverence.

The acronym (SWT) stands for "Subhanahu wa Ta'ala" which translates to "Glorious is He and He is Exalted" and it is mentioned after the name of God like so: Allah (SWT), as a form of veneration of God.
The name of one of the angels of God.
Good health and well being. It is also used as a girls' name.
The word aal means kinsfolk or family. For example, Aali Muhammed(AS) means the family of Muhammed.
The Arabic word 'alam means "a world" - usually refering to this world.
High or sublime. The spelling "Ali" should be used if it's for a name.
A 'amil is a worker.
This name's meaning comes from the word 'isma and is used to describe a person who keeps away from sin.
Aauzu (better spelled a`udhu) is used in popular Islamic phrases like a`udhu billah minashaitanir rajeem. The word is translated to mean 'I seek refuge', or 'I seek protection'.
Ab or Abb means Father.

The `Abayah is a long cloak that women wear. Depending on how it is worn and how long it is, it suffices as a suitable hijab and dress on its own if it covers the head (except the face) and the body (except the hands) properly.
See Ab.
A popular boy's name meaning resembling a lion in might and bravery.
Servant/Slave. eg. the name Abdullah means servant of Allah.

The word Abdul doesn't mean anything much by itself. Alone it means 'servant/slave of'. It often features as the prefix of a name - for example Abdul Rahman, a popular boy's name, means servant/slave of the all Merciful (God).
The name Abdullah means servant of Allah. It was the name of the Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) father.
A pleasant flowery fragrance. This is sometimes used as a girl's name.
Abel is one of the sons of Prophet Adam (PBUH). He is known as Habeel in Arabic. His brother was called Cain (Qabeel).
A worshipper.

Abiha (pronounced Abeeha), means "Her Father". Fatima (AS), the daughter of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW), was nicknamed Umm Abiha (Her father's Mother) by him because she used to care about and look after him so much.
dictionary.more: The masculine form of this word is Abooh (modern Arabic) or Abah.

dictionary.meaning: Ablution is an English word that means 'washing or wiping parts of the body with water as part of a religious rite'. The Arabic word for this is Wudhu`. Wudhu` is a rite done to prepare for prayer or reading the Quran, or to remain in the state of purity.
Prophet Abraham is one of the closest Prophets to Allah.
dictionary.more:
Abraham was the "Close One to Allah" Who preferred him over many others and selected him to be a messenger. Though brought up in a pagan community that worshiped idols, Abraham refused to do so and realized that there must be a greater god of the universe. Allah guided him to the right path and revealed His message to him. He then directed his mission to his people, and called on them to renounce idolatry. He was answered with stubborn refusals. They plotted against him but their schemes were in vain, for Allah, the Almighty, provided support and protection to His servant and prophet, Abraham. Abraham was the forefather of a line of prophets through his two sons Ishmael and Isaac. It was Abraham who began the construction of the Ka`bah with the help of his son Ishmael.

In Quranic Arabic the word ibraheem is spelled differently to how it is spelled in modern Arabic. It is spelled without a 'ya' character in the qur'an: إبراهم.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Abu means Father or 'Father of ...'. For example, 'Abu Ahmed' means Father of Ahmed. In Arab countries most people are called Abu X, (where X is the name of the first son or daughter,) by people who know them, instead of their official name.
(2) Abu can also mean 'possessor of X', where X can be an attribute or a distinct object. For example the name Abu Huraira means 'Possessor of Cats'.

Also of interest to you may be the word Umm.
dictionary.more: Abu Huraira (RA) is one of the most well known Hadith transmitters and Sahabah. He has transmitted an incredible number of hadiths.

dictionary.meaning: Abu Bakr is the name of one of the most famous Sahabah (companions of Prophet Muhammed) and he became the first Khalif (leader) after the death of the Prophet (SAW).

Abu Talib (RA) is the most famous uncle of Prophet Muhammed (SAW), and is the father of Ali ibn Abu Talib (AS), the Prophet's cousin. Abu Talib adopted Muhammed in youth after his grandfather (Abdul Muttalib) died and after the Prophet proclaimed his message of Islam, Abu Talib (RA) protected the Prophet from his many enemies until he passed away. There is some debate about whether or not he died a Muslim.
The color white.
Manners or etiquette. Proper manners and how best to behave according to Islamic principles can be derived from detailed study of the Sunnah, but most people learn their manners from their parents.
Adam is the name of the first human being created by God. Adam is a popular Muslim boy's name.
`adhab means punishment or torture.
The adhan (sometimes called azaan) is the call to prayer, recited before prayers commence. It is done to make people aware that the salat (prayers) are about to begin.
dictionary.more:
There are variations in the call to prayer in each of the sects and madhhabs.

Translation of the most common version:

God is most great. God is most great.
God is most great. God is most great.
I testify that there Is no god except God.
I testify that there is no god except God.
I testify that Muhammad is the messenger of God.
I testify that Muhammad Is the messenger of God.
Come to prayer! Come to prayer!
Come to success! Come to success!
God is most great. God is most great.
There is no god except God.

dictionary.meaning: The word 'adhraa` (pronounced 'adh-raa`) means virgin. Mary (RA), the mother of Christ (PBUH), is called Maryam al-'adhraa` - The Virgin Mary.
Adil ('adil) is a popular boy's name which means 'fair' or 'just'.
'Adila is a girls' name or word used to describe a woman who is upright, fair and just.
The word ad'iyah (pronounced ad-'iyah) is the plural form of the word dua. Ad'iyah means supplications and invocations to God.
'adl means fairness and justness. A person who has these characteristics is known as an 'adil' person. Adil is also a popular boy's name.
'adu means enemy.
Adyan is the plural of deen (religion).
`Afwen means sorry. Another word for sorry is 'Al-`afoo'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for `afwen.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for age is 'Umur'.
One. Often this word is used in reference to the oneness of Allah (God).
dictionary.more: The word for the number one is wahid.

dictionary.meaning: Ahadeeth is the plural of word hadith. Ahadeeth are narrations by/about the Prophet Muhammed (SAW).

Ahkam (pronounced with a slightly elongated 'a' sound) are laws or rulings. There are six types in Islam:
1. Compulsory (Wajib)
2. Recommended (Mustahab)
3. Forbidden (Haram)
4. Disliked (Makruh)
5. Legal and allowed (Halal)
6. No law defined/required (Mubah).
dictionary.more: Most clerics and teachers will only state the first 5 of the laws. The sixth one is essential because it asserts the fact that some things are ambiguous and do not have a legal ruling concerning them.

dictionary.meaning: A plural word meaning Dreams. The singular is hilim or hulum depending on the dialect. It is also used as a girl's name.
This is a phrase used in welcoming guests. It is a very old Arab greeting.

The Ahlulbayt are the family of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). They hold a special place in the hearts of the Mu'mineen (devout believers). There is some debate about who qualifies to be a member of his household - are the wives of the Prophet included or not? Nonetheless, the definite members of the household are:
(1) The Prophet Muhammed himself, 
(2) Ali (Cousin of the Prophet, and husband to his daughter), 
(3) Fatimah (Daughter of the Prophet, and wife of Ali), 
(4) Hassen (Son of Ali and Fatimah), 
(5) Hussain (Son of Ali and Fatimah).
May Allah's blessings be bestowed upon them all.
Fool or idiot.
The color red in Arabic.
Literally meaning "better".
Ahzab (pronounced with a slightly elongated a in the middle) is the plural of hizb. Hizb means political party or group.
The word 'ain can refer to the letter 'ain (ع) in the Arabic alphabet, or the word for eye, source or water spring.

Aisha (pronounced aa-isha), is the name of one of Prophet Mohammed's (SAW) wives, and she is the daughter of one of the Prophet's companions - Abu Bakr. Aisha is a common name for Muslim girls and it means 'living'.
This slang Arabic word means 'Yes'. It is commonly used in Egypt.
Ajma'een means 'All of Them'.

When a good deed or action is done, a Muslim gets 'ajr' for doing it. Ajr (or ajur) is also known as thawab, and it is like a 'plus' point. 'Plus' points are compared to 'negative' (ithim) points when someone is judged by God after the person dies. If a person has more thawab than ithim then they will enter heaven.
Ajzaa` is the plural of juzu`. It means 'parts' (usually of the Quran, which is split into 30).

(1) Akbar can mean 'The greatest' and is often found in the phrase Allahu Akbar: God is the Greatest.
(2) Akbar can mean 'Greater than' in age, size or value; E.g. Sitah akbar min khamsa, Six is greater than five.
Brother. (Not necessarily by blood).
See Akhi.
Means 'my brother'. The 'i' on the end changes the attributes of the word akh (brother) to belong to the subject.
The word akhirah means end, or ending. Also see Al Akhirah.
Manners or morals.
See Akh.
dictionary.more: Akhu is a valid word.

dictionary.meaning: Akhuk means 'Your brother'.
Coming from the word Kareem, this word and name means "most generous".
"The", or "of the".
dictionary.more:
It is used before most words. In english it is normal to list things: sun, moon, dog, cat; but in Arabic it is written A-shams, Al-Qamar, Al-Kelb, Al-Qitah.

This is used a lot like 'le' or 'la' in the French language. It's placing in a sentance is similar to French, e.g. Le Lit (The Bed) - Al-Firash.
But there are some words that use 'A' without including the 'l' or use 'As' instead, e.g. A-Shams (The Sun) or As-Samaa (The Sky). This is because of Arabic grammar rules.

dictionary.meaning: Al-Akhira refers to The Last Day which is Judgement day. When this day arrives, every person will be called to account for their actions during their life before a judgement is passed to whether they enter heaven or hell.

Al Amin (or Al Ameen) was one of the nick-names given to the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). It means 'The trustworthy', and the Prophet was well known by the people for this trait, and he was implicitly trusted by all, including his enemies.
Al Fatiha - 'The Opening (Chapter)'. This is the name of first Surah (chapter) in the Quran.
Al Khidhr was a person who was sent to test the patience of Prophet Moses (PBUH) and teach him the wisdom of God. Some say he was a Prophet as well. His name means: the green.
Al Quds is the Arabic name for the town of Jerusalem, Palestine. The word Quds is derived from a word meaning Holy.
This word means 'upon you', but it is usually found with a word preceding it, especially the word assalamu so it is 'assalamu alaikum' - peace be upon you.
Alan is an English name meaning 'Handsome one'.
Alastair is an English name meaning 'Defender of Men'.

`Alayhi-salam means 'Upon Him/Her Be Peace'. It is a respectable phrase said after mentioning a Prophet, an Imam or other very high-status figures. It is often represented by the acronym (AS), or the English acronym of Peace Be Upon Him (PBUH).
Albert is an English name meaning 'Noble' or 'Bright'.
Alex, short for Alexander, is an English name meaning 'Great Protector'.
Alexander is an English name meaning 'Great Protector'.
Alfred is an English name meaning 'Supernaturally Wise'.
Praise be to Allah. This phrase is said in thanks to God.

(1) Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS), often called Imam Ali, is one of the most famous sahabah (companions) of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). Ali was also the Prophet's cousin and he became the husband of the Prophet's daughter, Fatimah (AS). Ali and Fatimah had four children and the most famous were Hassen and Hussain. Ali was blessed with the title Ameer Al Mu'mineen (Commander of the Faithful) by the Prophet. Ali became the fourth Khalif after the death of the Prophet and Ali is often titled Imam Ali and is loved by all Muslims. Ali is a very popular boy's name.
(2) Ali may also mean high in grandeur but the spelling of this word is usually altered to be 'aliy' or in other ways, as the word aliy may be used as a description of God - Al Aliy ul Adheem - The Most High and Most Mighty. In Arabic the word Ali and Aliy are spelled the same.
See Ali.
dictionary.more: The Abi in Abi Talib should be written as Abu.

dictionary.meaning: The word 'Alim means learned person or scholar. 'Alim in a particular context can also mean having knowledge of any specific subject.
High or sublime. This is a popular girls' name.

dictionary.grammar: arabic; name; no gender association; no plural;
dictionary.meaning: Allah is the Arabic word for 'God' as well as the main name of God in Islam.
dictionary.more:
The word Allah was in usage since the days of pre-Islamic Arabia and was used especially by monotheists and followers of the Abrahamic faith. Arab Christians use the word Allah to refer to God as well.

The Islamic concept of mankind's place in the universe hinges on the notion that Allah, or God, is the truth and only with him is everlasting salvation. There is nothing permanent other than Him. Allah is considered eternal and uncreated, whereas everything else in the universe is created and destined for destruction. Allah is considered by Muslims to be all-powerful, all-seeing and all-knowing and is not resident or dependent on our universe. The Qur'an describes Him in Sura 112: "Say: He is Allah, Singular. Allah, the Absolute. He begetteth not nor was begotten. And to Him have never been one equal".

Muslims do not try to draw or depict Allah in any way as God has no physical form and the creation of physical resprentations often leads to idolatry, which is absolutely forbidden in Islam. Instead, they focus on His 99 attributes/names many of which are stated in the Quran, the holy book of the Muslims. The ninety-nine attributes are frequently written in calligraphic Arabic as a permissible decoration, which adorns mosques and homes of Muslims.

dictionary.meaning: Allahu Akbar means 'God is the Greatest', meaning that nothing can supersede God or be better than Him. It is a common phrase in Islam and it features in the adhan and prayer. Muslims tend to use it for lots of reasons and to express many emotions.
Allahu A'lem means "God knows".
Safety and security.
An operation.

Ameen is the Arabic version of the word Amen which has its origins in Hebrew and means 'so be it'. Ameen is often said after a supplication (dua) with the spiritual meaning: "O Allah, respond to (or answer) what I/we have said".
dictionary.more: Ameen is often mentioned in the daily prayers of most Muslims after the recitation of the opening surah from the Quran.

dictionary.meaning: This is a popular phrase commonly mentioned at the end of prayers and it means "Amen O' Lord of the worlds".
Leader or commander. It is a common name for males.
See Ameen.
See Al-Ameen.
Amina bint Wahab was the name of the Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) wet nurse.
See Ameer.

Means 'Commander of the Belivers' or 'Commander of the faithful'. This title was given to the Imam Ali (AS) specifically by the Prophet Muhammed (SAW), but was later attributed to anybody who became a khalif (not by the Prophet (SAW)), so there is amir al-mumineen Abu Bakr, amir al-mumineen Umar, Uthman, muawiyah, yazeed etc.

dictionary.grammar: word; name of female; feminine; masculine=amir;
dictionary.meaning: Amira is the feminine form of the name 'Amir'. Amira means leader or commander (feminine), and it is a popular girl's name.
Ana translates into either 'I am' or 'me' depending on the grammer of a sentance.
Ana bi khair means 'I am well'. It is a response to the question 'kayfa halek?' - how are you?.
Anas ibn Malik was a companion of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). He narrated many hadiths (sayings) from him.
dictionary.more: The name is more accurately pronounced quickly 'eness'.

dictionary.meaning: The word anasheed is plural. Anasheed are religious songs. The singular word is nasheed.
The word anbiya` is a plural word meaning 'Prophets'. The singular form is nabi (or nabey).
Andrew is an English name meaning 'Valiant'.
A descriptive word meaning slender, thin or stylish.
dictionary.more: The feminine form of the word is aneeqah (انيقه).

dictionary.meaning: A (feminine) descriptive word meaning slender, thin or stylish.
dictionary.more: The masculine form of the word is aneeq (انيق).

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for angel is malak.
See Aneeqah.
Madam or Miss.
A plural word meaning Stars. The singular is najm. Its is sometimes used as a name.

Literally means helpers or supporters. In Islamic history the people of Madinah who responded to the Prophet's call to Islam, becoming Muslims, and welcomed him to Madina when he emmigrated there from Makkah are known as the Ansar.
Anta means 'you' or 'you are'.
Anthony is an English name meaning 'Priceless'.

dictionary.grammar: word; plural; singular=nur; name of female; name of male;
dictionary.meaning: Anwar is the plural of 'nur' which means light. It is sometimes used as either a girl's (especially) or boy's name.

A place just outside of Makkah, in Mina where the first Muslims from Yathrib Madinah pledged allegiance to the Prophet in the year 621 C.E.. A similar meeting took place the next year when more Muslims from Yathrib pledged their allegiance to the Prophet.

The belief system that is based upon a firm conviction in all the fundamentals of faith and of the Oneness of Allah, i.e. creed.
It is derived from the verb aqada meaning to firmly bind and knot. Whatsoever settles in the heart in a firm and definitive manner is said to be that person's aqeedah.
In the technical sense it refers to the definitive faith and certain ruling that is not open to any doubt. It is called aqeedah because the person binds his heart upon it.

`aqeeq is a semi-precious stone, Garnet, used in jewellery, especially rings. Garnet is often found as a maroon colored stone but can also be found in many other colors including red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, brown, black, pink and even colorless. The rarest color is blue.
dictionary.more: Prophet Muhammed (SAW) used to wear a ring with an `aqeeq stone and it is recommended for Muslim men to wear them as well.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Sane, not mentally incapacitated.
(2) Friendly, good and pleasant.
`Aql means 'mind'. The phrase 'Ista'mil 'aqlek' translates into 'Use your mind'.

Aqsa means farthest (most far away). The Qur'an, chapter Al-Israa' (17), God refers to Al-Aqsa Mosque (place of prostration), to which the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) travelled to Jerusalem one night during the Israa' night journey.

Arabic is the language of the Arabs. Many non-Arabs also speak the language and it comes in many dialects which can be so different an person from one country will have difficulty understanding the other. Arabic is called '`Arabee' in Arabic. It is a very popular language and the Quran is written in Arabic.
The area that surrounds Mount Rahmah, southeast of Makkah.

A plain north of Makkah. It is on this plain that humanity will be raised on the Day of Judgement for questioning and judgement. During the Hajj on the ninth day of the month of Zhu-l-Hijjah, Muslim pilgrims gather on this plain for one day.
Araham is a plural word meaning 'wombs'.
Aware or knowing. This is a popular boy's name.
Arnold is an English name meaning 'Strong as an Eagle'.

The word 'arsh means throne. The specific throne often mentioned in Islamic theology is the throne of Allah. It is believed to be physical by the Muslims but is sometimes mentioned metaphorically in the Quran as a means of presenting the power and authority of God as he is King and Ruler of the universe.
Arthur is an English name meaning 'Champion'.
See Salat.

dictionary.grammar: name of animal; name of male;
dictionary.meaning: Asad means lion. It has also been used for a boy's name.

The tenth day of the Islamic month of Muharram. On this day the memorial of Moses' (AS) salvation from the hands of Pharaoh, and the slaying of the Grandson of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW), Hussain (AS) and his companions, and his children are remembered.

dictionary.grammar: name of place; name of female;
dictionary.meaning:
(1) Asiya bint Muzahim (AS) is the name of Pharoah's wife. She found Prophet Musa (AS) as a baby and convinced Pharoah not to murder him. She then rejected her husband's claim of divinity and was a Muslim as she chose monotheism. Some Muslim girls are called Asiya.
(2) Asiya is what Arabs call the continent of Asia.
Origin.
Asr means Evening; It is also the name of an obligatory Prayer (salat) that consists of four rak`ahs; it is performed in the same way as the Al-Dhuhur Prayer.
See Assalamu Alaikum.

Peace be unto you. It is a shortened form of the grand greeting: Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh (Peace be unto you and so may the mercy of Allah and His blessings). The greeting is recommended to be only used between Muslims.
dictionary.more: In reply to this a person may repeat the greeting and say: Assalamu Alaikum; However, it is more fitting to reply: Wa Alaikum Assalam.

dictionary.word: assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh
dictionary.script: السلام عليكم و رحمة الله و بركاته
dictionary.meaning: "Peace be unto you and so may the mercy of Allah and His blessings". It is the full version of the Islamic greeting.
A misspelling of Al-Salatu, means The Prayers - often referring to the five daily prayers enjoined on Muslims.

An Arabic phrase meaning "I ask Allah forgiveness." A Muslim says this phrase many times, even when he is talking to another person. When a Muslim abstains from doing wrong, or even when he wants to prove that he is innocent of an incident he uses this expression.
The color black.
Atfal is a plural word meaning 'Children'. The singular form is tifl.
Punishment or torture.
See Adhan.
'Atif is a popular boy's name meaning affectionate and kind.
Audhu is usually part of a phrase: Audhu Billahi Minashaitanir Rajeem. It means 'I seek refuge'.
'I seek refuge from the accursed Satan'. This phrase is often recited to ward away evil and before saying bismillahi rahman ar-Raheem before reading the Quran or other activities.
See Awrah.
See Aws.
This word means 'first'.
Awliya' is the plural of wali. It means guides, leaders, saints, etc.

(1) Parts of the body that are not supposed to be exposed to others and should not be shown in public.
(2) A misdeed - something that is shameful about oneself that they wish to hide.
Aws is a popular boy's name. The word Aws is the name of a tribe that was prominent in the city of Madinah during the time of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW).
dictionary.more: The Aws often fought with another tribe, the Khazraj, in Madinah, but when the Prophet (SAW) settled in Madinah he made peace between them and they lived peacefully and happily together. Single-handed he had stopped decades of war and loss of life and bound the tribes through Islam.

dictionary.meaning: Proof, evidence, verse (from the Quran), lesson, sign, revelation, miracle etc.
Ayat is the plural of ayah which means a verse from the Quran but it can also mean proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, miracles, etc.

A high-ranking cleric of the Shia Muslims is known as an Ayatollah. The word means 'sign of God'. Ayatollahs wear traditional clothes when preaching or teaching. They wear black or white turbans with the black turbans signifying they are descendants of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) through his Ahlulbayt (AS).
dictionary.more: There is a difference between a normal Ayatollah and a grand Ayatollah. A grand Ayatollah is a marje' and gives direction and writes fatwas to the Muslims who follow him (taqleed) in terms of religious law and fiqh. A normal Ayatollah does not present his own fatwas. Shia Muslims follow a marje's fatwas on shariah issues.

dictionary.meaning: Means 'Verse (of the) ...'. For example there is Ayatul Kursi which means Verse of the throne, in the Quran.
In the Quran, Surah Baqara (Chapter of the Cow), Ayah (verse) 255 is very beautiful and special and is given this title: "verse of the throne".
dictionary.more: [2.255] Allah is He besides Whom there is no god, the Everliving, the Self-subsisting by Whom all subsist; slumber does not overtake Him nor sleep; whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth is His; who is he that can intercede with Him but by His permission? He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot comprehend anything out of His knowledge except what He pleases, His knowledge (throne) extends over the heavens and the earth, and the preservation of them both tires Him not, and He is the Most High, the Great.

dictionary.meaning: See Aisha.
See Ain.
Where or wherever.
See Ayyoob.
Prophet Ayyoob (also written Ayoob or Ayub) is known as Job in the English bible.
dictionary.more: Ayyoob was a Prophet who lived a sheltered and prosperous life so God decided to test him after Satan said that Ayyoob was only grateful to God due to material wealth. Ayyoob was tested by his Lord and he lost his livelihood, his house, wives, children and he also became very ill, but he remained constant in his devotion to God and worship saying - 'God has taken away what he gave me and I was only the caretaker of his property for a while. God gives to whom he wills and he takes away from whom he wills'. God was impressed with this patience and devotion and in time the Prophet had all his things return back to him but better and more, and he become healthier and happier than ever before. This story is an example for the believers that they should be ready to be tested and be patient even if they may lose their loved ones and possessions.

dictionary.meaning: See Aaiza.
See Athab.
See Athan.

dictionary.grammar: word; name of male; name of God;
dictionary.meaning: Aziz (pronounced azeez) is a popular boy's name. It means wise. One of the names of God is 'Al Aziz'.
The color blue in Arabic.
Door or gate.
Arabic for dad/father. A son or daughter would call his or her father baba.
A Hindi name meaning Lion.
The Arabic word for bad is 'Sayyi`'.

The name of the first full military confrontation between the Muslims and the pagans. The battle took place between the Muslims and the Quraish of Makkah in the second year of Hijrah (624 C.E.). Even though the Muslims were outnumbered, the final result was victory.
Bait (also spelled bayt) means 'house'.
Baitul means 'house of...'. An example of the usage of this word is the term 'baitul mal' - the house of currency (National Treasury).

The national treasury. Everybody in the Muslim state that pays taxes has the money go into the baitul mal (the house of currency). The money from this is used to fund the state, its endeavors and to support the poor.
Stingy and ungenerous.
Bakkah is another name for Makkah. It is thought to be the original name of the place and it is mentioned in the Quran.
dictionary.more:
[3.96] Most surely the first house appointed for men (and women) is the one at Bakkah, blessed and a guidance for the nations.
[3.97] In it are clear signs, the standing place of Ibrahim, and whoever enters it shall be secure, and pilgrimage to the House is incumbent upon men for the sake of Allah, (upon) every one who is able to undertake the journey to it; and whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is Self-sufficient, above any need of the worlds.

dictionary.more: Depending on who's fiqh interpretations a Muslim follows, the ages of bulugh vary. Often for boys, the age of bulugh is considered to be 15.5 years of age, whereas for girls it is 9 and up, or when they start to have periods.

The word barakat means blessings (plural). The singular word is barakah.

Barzakh, or Barzach (an alternative spelling), is a stage of existence that follows immediately after death. Muslims believe that when a person dies, the soul lives on in a special stage of time. In Barzakh the person is asked questions in the grave and may receive blessings or torments. When judgment day comes they are led to either heaven, hell or limbo, but while they are waiting for that day to arrive they are in the state of Barzakh.

Bid'ah, (also spelled bid'a) means innovation. When used in an Islamic context, bid'a means the addition/removal/ignorance of an Islamic law or teaching and is something that is considered an evil. Bid'ah usually goes against what is written in authentic hadiths and the Quran or goes against what the Prophet (SAW) practiced and taught.
dictionary.more:
The Prophet (SAW) said: "If anyone introduces an innovation in the religion, he will be responsible for it. (Good or bad). If anyone introduces an innovation or gives shelter to a man who introduces an innovation (in the religion) he is cursed by Allah, by His angels and by all the people." [Sunnan Abu Dawud]

The Prophet (SAW) also said: "Whoever does an action which we (Allah and His Messenger) have not commanded, it will be rejected." [Muslim - Sahih]

There are many understandings about what is or isn't bidah, so it is advisable to ask a scholar.

Dhabeehah is the method of ritual slaughter by which an animal is slaughtered according to Islamic law. Muslims are only allowed to consume certain live-stock animal's meat if they have been slaughtered using the Islamic method.
dictionary.more:
There are a number of conditions that need to be met before meat can be certified permissible to eat, halal, for a Muslim. Not all animals are allowed to be consumed by Muslims, e.g. pig.

The most commonly-eaten meats are that of livestock - cows, sheep and chickens, and they have to be slaughtered by a Muslim while facing the direction of Makkah, with the name of God mentioned while using a sharp knife to cut the throat and blood vessels of the animal's neck with one quick swipe.

Fish does not need to be slaughtered in this way. In order for a fish to be halal it must have been caught alive and well before being taken out of the water, and it must die outside of the water (through drowning in air). Some Muslims stipulate the type of fish is important and will only eat fish that have scales.

In Islam, animals are only meant to be slaughtered for food and cannot be hunted for game or killed for no good purpose. The slaughter should be as quick and as painless as possible too.

  In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
[93.1] I swear by the early hours of the day,
[93.2] And the night when it covers with darkness.
[93.3] Your Lord has not forsaken you, nor has He become displeased,
[93.4] And surely what comes after is better for you than that which has gone befor
[93.5] And soon will your Lord give you so that you shall be well pleased.
[93.6] Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter?
[93.7] And find you lost (i.e. unrecognized by men) and guide (them to you)?
[93.8] And find you in want and make you to be free from want?
[93.9] Therefore, as for the orphan, do not oppress (him).
[93.10] And as for him who asks, do not chide (him),
[93.11] And as for the favor of your Lord, do announce (it).

dictionary.meaning: Eid means celebration. There are two official Eids in Islam and they are Eid al-fitr (celebration of the feast of breaking fast at the end of Ramadhan) and Eid al-Adhha (celebrating the completion of the hajj).

Eid Al-Adhha translates to 'The Celebration of the Sacrifice'. The word Eid means celebration or festival. The word Adhha comes from the word dhahiyyah (noun) which means slaughter or sacrifice (or victim). 
Eid Al-Adhha is one of the two Eids (days of celebration in the Islamic calendar). The other Eid is Eid al-Fitr and happens at the end of the holy month of fasting, Ramadhan. Eid al-Adhha occurs on the tenth day of the last month of the Islamic calendar (Dhul-Hijjah).
dictionary.more: Eid al-Adhha is celebrated to mark a significant historical event relating to Prophet Abraham (PBUH) when he was tested by his Lord who commanded him to slaughter his only son Ismaeel (Ishmael) (PBUH) and when he was just about to make the cut, God sent down a ram for him to slaughter instead. Abraham's faith had been tested and he had passed the test. This Eid is celebrated remembering this event and as part of the rites of pilgrimage (the Hajj), the people who do the pilgrimage must slaughter/pay-to-slaughter an animal likewise and distribute the meat amongst their family, other pilgrims, relatives, friends and the poor.

dictionary.meaning: Eid al-Fitr roughly translates to 'the celebration of the end of fasting'. Muslims fast during the Islamic month of Ramadhan and they conclude this month with a three day celebratory holiday, an Eid, known as Eid al-Fitr.

Islamic Jurisprudence. This is an extremely large and very complex topic of Islamic studies.
dictionary.more:
The meaning of the word fiqh is understanding, comprehension, knowledge, and jurisprudence in Islam. A jurist is called a Faqih who is an expert in matters of Islamic legal matters.

A Faqih is to pass verdicts within the rules of the Islamic Law, namely Shariah.

The most famous scholars of Fiqh in the Islamic history are the founders of the five schools of jurisprudence: Imam Malik, Imam Ash-Shafi'i, Imam Abu Hanifah, Imam Ahmad Ibn Hanbal and Imam Ja'far al-Sadiq.

Actions a person can make fall within five categories of legal classification. Sometimes intention or situation changes the classification of a deed. The five categories are:

1. Fardh/Wajib (Obligatory): This category is obligatory for the Muslim to do. Doing the Fardh counts as a good deed, and not doing it is considered a sin.

2. Mustahab/Mandub (Recommended): This category is recommended for the Muslim to do such as extra prayers. Doing the Mandub counts as a good deed but not doing it does not count as a sin.

3. Mubah (Allowed): This category is left undecided and left for the person to choose, such as deciding to eat apples or oranges.

4. Makruh (Disliked): This category is detested and disliked and includes actions such as growing very long fingernails or sleeping on the stomach. Not doing the Makruh counts as a good deed but doing it does not count as a bad deed.

5. Haram (Prohibited): This category is prohibited for the Muslim to do such as stealing and lying. Doing the haram counts as a bad deed and not doing it counts as a good deed.

Ghusl al-Janabah (wash of Janabah) is a special rite of washing to get the person out of janabah (an impure state). Janabah is a state which a person enters when they have had sex or ejaculated. They cannot pray if they have not done the gusl al-janabah (wash of janabah) in order to cleanse themselves.
dictionary.more:
The wash is very simple. A person makes the intention to wash, then they wash their head and neck fully, then they wash the whole of the right-hand side of the body, and then the left-hand side of the body. 
Alternatively, they can make the intention and then plunge themselves into a vast (kurr) pool of clear water (not swimming pool water).
If there is no water or if there's no time to wash before the prayer time finishes, they must do tayammum temporarily.

The Arabic word for good is 'jayed'. This sort of 'good' is a suitable reply when asked for the quality of an item or the health of an individual.
Good Morning in Arabic is 'Sabah al-Khair'.
A similar phrase to the English 'Good Night' is 'Tusbah ala Khair' which is Arabic for '(may you) wake up to goodness'.
The most common word for goodbye in Arabic is ma'asalama ((farewell) with peace).
The Arabic word for government is hukuma.
Musaddas or bunduqiyah.
dictionary.more: The Arabic text shown is for musaddas.

dictionary.meaning: The word habib on its own means 'beloved', but with the i on the end of the word you attribute the word to yourself so habibi means 'my beloved'. Also see Habibi.
Habeel, also spelled habil, is the name of the second son of Prophet Adam (PBUH). He was murdered by his brother Qabeel out of jelousy.
A popular boy's name meaning beloved.
A popular girl's name meaning sweetheart, darling or beloved.
Habibi means 'My love' or 'My beloved'. Habibi is the form of the word used to refer to men. The feminine form is 'habibti'.
Habibtek means 'your love'.
When a person wishes to say 'my dear' or 'my beloved' to a woman, he says 'habibti'. If it was said to a man, the word would be 'habibi'.
A guide to the right path. This is a popular boy's name.

It means "something new" or a "talk". In Islam, a hadith refers to one report from the total collection of sayings, actions, approvals, disapprovals and stories of the life of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). Hadiths are found in many books and collections with varying degrees of authenticity and accuracy.
Sometimes spelled Hafeeza, this girl's name comes from the concept of learning the Qur'an by heart.

(1) Hafidh means Protector or Guardian. It has been used as a boy's name.
(2) A person is labelled a 'hafidh' if he or she has memorized the whole Quran.
See Hafidh.
Hafsah is the name of one of the wives of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). She is the daughter of Umar bin al-Khattab, a famous sahabi (companion) of the Prophet.
Alive or living.
Haider is a popular boy's name. It means lion, and Haider was the original name Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS) was given by his mother.
The Arabic word for hair is 'Sha`ar'.
Arabic for rock or stone.
Hajir is the Arabic version of Hagar - the name of the wife of Prophet Abraham and the mother of Prophet Ishmael (PBUT).
Hajj is the fifth pillar of Islam. The Hajj is a pilgrimage to the city of Makkah in Saudi Arabia. Hajj is obligatory on every adult Muslim except those who are too ill or too poor to go.
A male who has gone to Makkah and done the obligatory Hajj ritual is called a Hajji. A female who has done it is known as a Hijjiyah.
Judge or referee.
Also spelled Hakim, this word means wise.
Speech.
A ruler or judge. This word is sometimes used as a boy's name but it is likely the name Hakeem is implied which means wise.
Permissible, lawful. Used especially in reference to food.

(1) A ring
(2) An episode.
Halima al-Sa'diyyah was one of the wet nurses of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) when he was a baby.
Ham is pig meat, so the Arabic words means pig meat - Laham al-khanzeer.
A dove. This is also used as a girl's name.
Praise. The word Hamd alone is not very useful but when used in phrases like 'Al hamdu lillah', (The) Praise be to Allah, it is effective.
A popular boy's name meaning commending or one who praises Allah.
A bathroom or public bath house.
A boy's name meaning "one who praises Allah". Also spelled Hamoodi.

Hamzah (RA) was one of the uncles of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). He died a martyr in the battle of Uhud after being struck with a spear in his back. He was titled 'assadullah', the lion of God, as he was a very strong and brave defender of Islam.
A popular boy's name meaning delighted.
Pronounced Haneef, is an upright believer of the original religion, the religion of the one true God.
A popular girl's name meaning affection.
The Arabic word for happy is farhan.
This word could mean: Truth, Truthfulness, Prerogative, Birthright, Correct, Right,  etc.
Har means hot. If someone wishes to say the weather is hot in Arabic they say 'Al-Jawu har'.
dictionary.more: Another word for hot is sakhin.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Prohibited, illegal. Mostly used in reference to actions as well as foods.
(2) Sacred/Holy - as in Masjid al-Haram (The sacred mosque) in Makkah and within it is the Kaaba.
In Arabic the word harami means thief or burglar, but in some Asian languages such as Urdu it has taken on a different meaning: bastard.
War or battle.
Harith is an old Arabic name meaning ploughman.
See Harun.
Harry is an English name meaning 'Power'.

Harun (or Haroon) is Aaron in English. Prophet Aaron (PBUH) was Moses's eloquent brother who helped him proclaim his mission to Pharaoh. When Moses (PBUH) went to fulfill the appointment with his Lord on Mount Sinai, Aaron succeeded him in leading the Israelites. During this period a man called Al-Samiri suggested to the Israelites that they make the golden figure of a calf to worship. Thus they went astray and committed a great sin. Aaron persistently tried to convince them to return to the worship of Allah, but they did not listen to him. Upon his return, Moses was angered by the Israelites and began to re-educate them about the true religion.

(1) Good or acceptable. Used to indicate authenticity of some reports in Hadith.
(2) The name of the Grandson of the Prophet (SAW) and son of Imam Ali (AS). Also written as Hassan, Hasen, Hassen.

When a good deed is done a Muslim gains positive points called hasanat or thawab. When a person is brought before God for judgement their good deeds will be weighed-up against their bad deeds (ithim).
An old Arab name. One of the ancestors of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) was called Hashim and the Bani Hashim/Hashemite tribe to which he belonged was named after him.

(1) The name of the Grandson of the Prophet (SAW) and son of Imam Ali (AS). Also written as Hassan, Hasen, Hassen.
(2) Good or acceptable.
The Arabic word for hate is Karahah.
dictionary.more: To say that you hate cheese for example, you say 'Ikreh Jibin'.

dictionary.meaning: Hawaa is the name of Prophet Adam's wife, know as Eve in English books.

Haya' means shyness or bashfulness. It is a popular girl's name.

Also see Hayat.
Life.
An old Arab name meaning eagle/hawk.
The Arabic word for heart is qelb.
The Arabic word for heaven (paradise) is 'Jannah'.
See Hibah.
The Arabic word for hell is Jahanam.
The Arabic word for hello is marhaba but most commonly used is Assalamu Alaikum which is the universal Muslim greeting.

The Arabic word for help is 'musa`edeh'. 
To say 'help me' you say 'sa`idni'. 
'Can you help me please' is 'mumkin tsa`idni min fadhlek'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for 'musa`edeh'.

dictionary.meaning: Henry is an English name meaning 'Ruler of the House'.
See Hibah.
Hibah means gift - a gift from Allah. It is a popular girl's name.
Guiding - guiding someone to the true path. This word is sometimes found used as a girl's name.
See Hijrah.

Literally means concealing, screening, cover, protecting and is often used to refer to the mandatory (wajib) dress of the muslim female. There are many different forms of hijab but the one most commonly meant when the word hijab is used is usually the scarf (rabtah) that is wound around the head to cover the hair, the ears and the neck.
dictionary.more: The hijab is not restricted to dress alone. The principle of hijab applies to modesty and reightousness in behaviour as well and both men and women are required to be modest and not attracting of the opposite sex.

dictionary.meaning: Hijabi is a slang term used to label a lady as a hijab (veil) wearing woman. It is not derogatory. The term that is better used to refer to a veiled woman is muhajjibah.
dictionary.more: Hijabi is not a recognised Arabic word so the Arabic shown here mimicks the phonetic pronunciation.

dictionary.meaning: A female who has gone to Makkah and done the obligatory Hajj ritual is called a Hijjiyah. A male who has done it is known as a Hajji.

Means migration. The Hijrah refers to the Prophet's migration from Makkah to Madinah. This journey took place in the twelfth year of his mission (622 C.E.). This is the beginning of the Muslim calendar. By islamic law the word hijrah usually refers to leaving a place to seek sancturary or freedom from persecution or freedom of religion or any other purpose. Hijrah can also mean to leave a bad way of life for a good or more righteous way.
Talk or speaking.
Hikmah means wisdom. Scholars are sometimes asked the hikmah for a ruling or law, and in that case they are being asked for the wisdom behind the law or a justification for it.
Crescent moon.
Nice or sweet.
The word hilwah means nice, pretty or beautiful. It has been used as a Girl's name.

dictionary.grammar: word; name of female; name of country;
dictionary.meaning: This word is the Arabic name for the country of India. It is also a popular girl's name. The mother of Muawiyyah was called Hind.
dictionary.more: The word Hind should be pronounced with the same sound when saying "wind".

dictionary.meaning: a party - usually political.

Hizbullah is formed from two words - Hizb meaning 'political party', and ullah is derived from the word Allah (God). Therefore Hizbullah means Party of God. Hizbullah is a religio-political organization based in the country of Lebanon and they have public and militant interests in the region. They aim to protect the Lebanese borders and the Palestinian state from terrorism and Israeli aggression and occupation.
Donkey.
See Hub.
The Arabic word for home is bayt.
See Hud.
See Huda.
An native inhabitant of heaven is known as a Hoori. Fatimah (AS), the Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) daughter was known as a human hooriyah.
dictionary.more: The 'yah' on the end of the word hoori above confirms that the subject is female - it is a language construct.

dictionary.meaning: See Hoori.
The Arabic word for hope is emel. Emel is a popular girl's name.
The Arabic word for hot, in reference to heat, is 'har'.
House in Arabic is 'bait'.
The Arabic word for 'how' is 'kayfa'.
The Arabic form of this phrase is 'Kayf Halek'.
The Arabic word for love is hub. Like in English, the word hub has many meanings and understanding, from love of family members to love of a spouse.
Hud (also spealt hood) is the name of a Prophet of Islam.
Huda (also spelled Hooda) is a popular girl's name. It means guidance.
The Hoopoe bird.
dictionary.more: Mentioned in the Qur'an in Surah Al-Naml (Chapter: The Ant) 27:20-22.

dictionary.meaning: An argument or proof for something. Or an excuse.
dictionary.more: Sometimes written Hujjat.

dictionary.meaning: A legal ruling or verdict.
Government.
The word 'Humaira`' was a nickname the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) gave to his wife Aisha, and this was because she had rosy cheeks. The word Humaira' means reddish.
Huqooq, sometimes spelled huquq, means rights.
dictionary.more: Example: Huqooq insaniyyah - Human Rights.

dictionary.meaning: Hur means 'free' as in free from prison.
Freedom.
See Hussain.
The English word 'husband' is 'zawj' in Arabic.
The English plural word 'husbands' is 'azwaj' in Arabic.
See Hussain.

Hussain, or Imam Hussain (AS), was the son of Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS) and Fatimah bint Muhammed (AS). Ali is the cousin of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) and Fatimah is the daughter of Prophet Muhammed, so Hussain was the grandson of the Prophet. Hussain died a martyr on Ashura, the tenth day of the Islamic month of Muharram along with the majority of his family and his companions, by the swords and arrows of the army of Yazid bin Mu'awiyah. Hussain is a very respected and loved figure in Islam. Many parents name their boys after him.
The word 'I' is 'ana' in Arabic. Ana can also mean 'I am'.
Ian is an English name meaning 'God is Gracious'.
Means worship. An act of ibadah is an act of worship done for the sake of Allah.

Ibid is a Latin acronym for ibidim and it means 'At the same place'. In many English Islamic books the list of references sometimes state this word. It means the referenced quote can be found in the same book as listed above. 
e.g.
1. The Holy Quran, by Allah, 1:1
2. Ibid; 27:30.
See Ibn.
Iblees is the name of the devil that caused Adam and Eve to be cast out of heaven. Iblees is known as the Shaitan (Satan).
See Iblees.
Ibn, or bin, means 'son of'. Eg: Ali `ibn` Abi Talib (AS) means Ali `son of` Abi Talib.

Abraham in English. He was the "Close One to Allah" Who preferred him over many others and selected him to be a messenger. Though brought up in a pagan community that worshiped idols, Abraham refused to do so and realized that there must be a greater god of the universe. Allah guided him to the right path and revealed His message to him. He then directed his mission to his people, and called on them to renounce idolatry. He was answered with stubborn refusals. They plotted against him but their schemes were in vain, for Allah, the Almighty, provided support and protection to His servant and prophet, Abraham. Abraham was the forefather of a line of prophets through his two sons Ishmael and Isaac. It was Abraham who began the construction of the Kaabah with the help of Ishmael.
A popular Girl's name meaning supplication.
Smiling. A popular girl's name.
A woman's prescribed waiting period after divorce or death of husband. It is 4 months and 10 days.
dictionary.more: If there was no period of iddah and the woman married another man and discovered she was pregnant then she would be unable to tell who the father of the child was. Iddah solves this potential problem. Iddah also applies in the situation where a man or woman converts while they are married to a non-Muslim; they have 4 months and 10 days to convince their partner to accept Islam or else the relationship becomes unlawful.

dictionary.grammar: name of prophet; name of male;
dictionary.meaning: Idrees, sometimes written Idris, is the name of a Prophet, called Enoch in the bible. Idrees is the name used for this Prophet in the Qur'an. Prophet Idrees preached the message of Tawheed (the oneness of God) to his people who were fire worshippers.

(1) Opening something.
(2) The action of conquering a town or nation - conquest.
dictionary.more: When Prophet Muhammed (SAW) first tried to peacefully return to his home town, Makkah, the pagans of Makkah denied him entry and forbade the Muslims to perform the pilgrimage to the Kaaba. Instead of fighting a war the prophet chose to enter into a treaty with them (the treaty of Hudaybiyyah) which would allow the Muslims to do the pilgrimage the following year and guarantee that normal Muslim civilians were not harmed or killed. The pagans later broke the treaty by continuing to provoke and harm Muslims and when they murdered a group of Muslims the Prophet marched his large army into Makkah. The Makkans decided it was better to surrender than to fight and the Prophet peacefully conquered Makkah. This is known as Fatih Makkah.

dictionary.meaning: Breaking the fast. Beginning to eat after the sun sets - especially during ramadhan.
A popular girl's name meaning being proud.
A popular boy's name meaning beneficence.

Ijtihad is the process whereby a very educated Muslim makes up his own ruling on the permissibility of an Islamic law just for himself. This person would be labelled a 'Mujtahid'. An uneducated person is not permitted to do this and must follow the ruling of his Imam instead.
The word ikhlas means 'sincerity'. It is the name of a surah (chapter) in the Quran. This chapter is also known by the name 'tawheed', which means unity.
dictionary.more:
The Qur'an, Chapter 112, The Unity
In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
[112.1] Say: He, Allah, is One.
[112.2] Allah is He on Whom all depend.
[112.3] He begets not, nor is He begotten.
[112.4] And none is like Him.

dictionary.meaning: Means brothers/sisters. Often used in sentances like 'nahnu ikhwa(tun)', we are brothers/sisters.
Ikhwan is the plural of Akh.
From the word Ikhwa which means brothers/sisters; the 'tun' on the end of the word is a diacritic (harakah).
Ikram is a popular boy's name and it means a generous offering or blessing.
Ilah is Arabic for "a God/Deity".
dictionary.more: La Ilah illa-llah - (There is) no Diety Except Allah.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for 'ill' is 'Mareedh'.
Literally means 'knowledge' or 'knowledge of ...'. It can also mean science.
Elijah in English. He was a prophet sent to the people of Baalbek, in east Lebanon. He called them to worship only Allah and stop adoring their idol Ba`la (Baal).

dictionary.grammar: word; name of male; name of female;
dictionary.meaning: See Iman.
A popular boy's name meaning "pillar of strength".

The word Imam has multiple meanings:

(1) The person who leads a congretional (jamaa) prayer
(2) The Muslim leader who runs the Masjid (Mosque)
(3) A Khalif (leader of the Muslim peoples)
(4) A normal leader of Muslims, but this leader usually provides at least some spiritual guidance
(5) Any one of 12 infallible members of the Ahlulbayt (family of the Prophet) (AS). (Shia)
(6) Any one of the 4 recognised fallible grand scholars of the Ahlul Sunnah wal Jama`ah. (Sunni)
(7) Any scholar who is deemed educated enough, usually a mujtahid
(8) An `Alim
(9) An Ayatollah
(10) A Mufti
(11) A person who is given the special status of Imam by God; e.g. Prophet Abraham (PBUH).
(12) A book containing the record of a persons deeds is called an Imam in verse 17:71 in the Qur'an.

Of these, numbers 1,2,5 and 6 are most correct to use.
dictionary.more: With Shia literature the word Imam is most likely to come under the meaning mentioned in 5; whereas Sunni literature refer to point 6, and sometimes 7.

dictionary.meaning: Faith. Iman (pronounced Eeman) is a popular girl's name.
dictionary.more: Iman is pronounced eeman but with the ee said said softer and the a slightly extended. Iman is the most popular spelling of the word although phonetically it is not accurate.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for woman. Another variation of this word is mar'ah.
Imran (RA) was the name of Mary the mother of Christs' father. One of the chapters of the Qur'an is named "Aali Imran" - The Family of Imran.

The word Imsak means to hold-off or refrain and is often used in reference to fasting.

When a Muslim is fasting and is having their suhoor (a pre-dawn meal before fasting commences), there comes a period when that person needs to hold off from food and water. This period is called imsak, and it is a few moments before the fajr (morning) prayers begins, after which they must keep their fast.
dictionary.more:
"... And eat and drink until the white thread becomes distinct to you from the black thread of the dawn...." [The Quran 2:187]

God describes the time when imsak begins by describing the first rays of the sun coming up the horizon as a white thread agains the black thread of the night. When this sign is observed it is time to stop eating and drinking and prepare for the fajr prayer. Most Ramadhan calendars have the time of Imsak written on them with a few more minutes added just to be safe.

dictionary.meaning: A popular boys name meaning distinction.

dictionary.word: ina lillahi wa ina ilayhi raajioon
dictionary.script: إنا لله و إنا إليه راجعون
dictionary.meaning: "To Allah we belong and unto Him is our return". Is said immediately upon hearing of the death of a Muslim.
A name meaning looking after and caring for someone.
There are a few things that make someone an infidel so you may find these Arabic words of interest: Kafir, Kufr, Mushrik, Shirk.

The Injeel is the holy book, or Gospel, that Allah gave to Prophet Jesus (PBUH). In todays world this book does not exist, but there are parts and influences from it found in the New Testament and other Gospels that did not make it into the Canon of the New Testament but these parts are not easy to point out. The Injeel IS NOT the New Testament because the NT was written after Jesus and by 4 main writters (amongst many) - Peter, Mark, Luke & John. There is no 'Gospel of Jesus'.
See Injeel.
'We are' or 'we have'.
A Person or Human.
Insha'llah could mean any one of the following variations: If Allah (God) wills; When Allah (God) wills; If Allah (God) wishes.
dictionary.more: People often mispronounce this word by joining up the three words that make it up - In, sha' and Allah - and pronouncing it as one word. The word should be pronounced - In,sha',llah.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for Interest is Ribba.
Suicide.
dictionary.more: Suicide is absolutely forbidden in Islam.

dictionary.meaning: Triumph or victory.
A popular boy's name meaning 'Accepting' (of Allah's decree).

Saying 'Iqra`' to someone is to order them to read. When Prophet Muhammed (SAW) was meditating in the cave of hiraa he was ordered to read by angel Jibraeel (Gabriel). Iqra` was the first word of the Quran that came upon the Prophet (SAW).
dictionary.more:
The angel repeated the order: iqra! Read! as Muhammed explained he was unable to read, then Jibraeel said:

[96.1] Read in the name of your Lord Who created.
[96.2] He created man from a clot.
[96.3] Read and your Lord is Most Honorable,
[96.4] Who taught (man to write) with the pen
[96.5] Taught man what he knew not.

These are the first verses of the Quran that came down to the Prophet.

dictionary.meaning: A form of Islamic mysticism, similar to sufism. The word irfan 'knowing' relates to trying to know and understand God.
Terrorism.
dictionary.more: A terrorist is known as an Irhabi.

dictionary.meaning: A terrorist.
Irham, as found in phrases like irham waldayk, is the command: Show graciousness/kindness/compassion to...
dictionary.more: Irham comes from the word rahmah - graciousness. Irham waldayk means: show kindness to your parents. This was one of the main commands given by the Prophet Muhammed (SAW).

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for Iron (Fe) is 'Hadeed'. One of the chapters of the Quran is called Al-Hadeed.
Isa is the name of Prophet Jesus (PBUH). Muslims believe Jesus was a Prophet without a father and the son of Mary the virgin (RA).
dictionary.more: Almost as Adam had been created without a father or mother, Jesus Christ was born without a father. He was Allah's Word inspired to Mary. Allah gave him Clear Signs and endowed him with the Holy Spirit. He was held in honour both in this world and the Hereafter and in the company of those nearest to Allah. Jesus was strong in spirit, and very wise. Allah bestowed upon him the power to speak eloquently while still an infant in his cradle. Indeed, Jesus's miracles were innumerable. Allah taught him the Wisdom and Book, the Torah and the Gospel. Allah made him His Messenger to the Children of Israel. By Allah's leave, Jesus made the figure of a bird out of clay and breathed into it and it became a bird. He could, by Allah's leave, heal those born blind, lepers and even resurrect the dead. Jesus invited his people to worship Allah, the Only True God and obey Him as He should be obeyed; but they rejected him and rebelled. Only the poor among them followed him. Allah raised Jesus up unto Himself and saved him from those who plotted to crucify him.

dictionary.meaning: Isaac is a Prophet, son of Prophet Abraham (PBUH). He is known as Is-haq in Arabic.
See Ishaa.
`ishaa' is a word that means night; It is also the name of an obligatory Prayer that is done at this time - Salat al `ishaa'. This prayer consists of four rak`ahs.

Pronounced 'is-haaq' is prophet Isaac (in English), son of Prophet Abraham by his wife Sarah, and the father of Prophet Jacob. The tidings of his birth were given to his parents by the angels who had been sent to destroy the city of the people of Lot. The Holy Qur'an referred to Isaac as "a son endowed with wisdom." Isaac was sent as a Prophet to guide people to the right way.
'ishq is a deeper form of love. The regular word for love is hub.
See Ism.

dictionary.grammar: Word or Name of Person; no gender; no plural;
dictionary.meaning:
(1) A monotheistic religion with the second largest following in the World.
(2) Submission (to the will of God).
dictionary.more: The Arabic word 'Islam' simply means 'submission', and derives from a word meaning 'peace'. In a religious context it means complete submission to the will of God. 'Allah' is the Arabic name for God, which is used by Arab Muslims and Christians alike. Read More...

dictionary.meaning:
The Islamic Calendar is 'Al-Taqweem al-Islami' in Arabic - it is often called the 'Hijri' Calendar because it is started from the 'Hijrah' (migration) of the Muslims from Makkah to Madina to escape persecution. This occurred in the year 620/621AD, so the year 2010 is 1431AH. AH means 'after hijrah'. 
There are 12 months in the Islamic calendar and the names of these months are:

Muharram
Safar
Rabi` al-Awal
Rabi` al-Thani
Jumadal-awal
Jumadal-thani
Rajab
Sha`ban
Ramadhan
Shawwal
Dhul Qi`dah
Dhul Hujjah

The calendar is based on the movements of the phases of the moon so it does not correlate perfectly with the Gregorian calendar which is based on the sun. There are 354 days in the lunar year (as a pose to 364 days in the solar year) and the Islamic months tend to start 10/11 days earlier than the solar year before so the start of the month is always changing - if the month of Ramadhan last year started on the 11th of October, we should expect it to start on the 1st of October next year.

The word "Islamist" is used by Western Media to describe any Muslim who does not conform to how they expect a subjugated Muslim should behave. Often, Muslims who do not respond positively to nor support Western imperialism, or have a political affiliation, or are perceived as conservative Muslims are labelled as "Islamists". It is a vague label used to promote ignorance and a person who is labelled an "Islamist" is viewed as the enemy or "the bad guy". Once a person is labelled an "Islamist" there is no intellectual effort to understand them or what they stand for, even though they might hold a normal opinion held by the majority, promote justice or support or head a democratic system of government.
dictionary.more: You will never hear a journalist using the word "Christianist" or "Jewist" but they will freely use the word "Islamist" for any Muslim in the headlines. They will call a terrorist an "Islamist" and at the same time call a democratically elected leader an "Islamist" without making any distinction between them and their listeners will view both people negatively and see them as the enemy or as extremists. The word invariably associates political affiliations or acts of violence with the religion of Islam even though their actions may not be Islamically acceptable. It's a word that promotes Islamophobia. This is why Muslims hate to hear such a word being used.

dictionary.meaning: Islamophobia is an ignorant and irrational fear or dislike of Islam, Muslims or things perceived to be Islamic in nature.
dictionary.more:
It is irrational and ignorant to fear a major world religion with 1.7 Billion followers, who come from all walks of life, come from different countries, are of different races and skin-colors, speak different languages, have different traditions and different political affiliations. Muslims are normal human-beings wishing to live their lives in peace and with faith in God. And Islam is an Abrahamic religion with the same roots as Judaism and Christianity and preaches the belief in God, doing good deeds, having high morals and worshipping God.

A person who holds a racist or bigoted opinion about Islam or Muslims is an Islamophobe. Islamophobia is a reprehensible attitude akin to anti-Semitism. A person who does not agree with certain tenants of the religion of Islam may not be an Islamophobe but if their only real reason for opposing an opinion is because it is perceived as "Islamic" then they are practising Islamophobia. As Human Beings we all need to accept that other people will hold different opinions but holding an opinion of intolerance to Islam is ignorance.

dictionary.meaning: The word 'ism' means 'name'. To say 'my name is Tom' in Arabic you say 'ismi Tom'.
'isma means infallibility in Arabic. Also see ma'soom.
Ishmael (in English) was the first son of Prophet Ibraham (AS) by his second wife, Hajir (RA) (Hagar in English).
See Ismaeel.
Isra', A popular Girl's name meaning night journey. The reference comes from the Isra' wa Mi'raj journey that the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) took when he visited the seven heavens.

Al-Israa' is one of the names of chapter 17 of the Qur'an which is also called Bani-Isra'eel. The Israa' is the first part of the Israa' and Mi'raj night journey undertaken by the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). In the Israa' journey, the Prophet, accompanied by the angel Gabrial, was taken from Makkah to Jerusalem, to the precincts of a holy place, the Al-Aqsa (Furthest) Mosque, where he led the past Prophets in a congregational prayer, before being taken on the next part of the journey, the Mi'raj into the heavens.

1) The Prophet Yaqoob (Jacob in English) was also called Israel which means "Servant of Allah".
2) The name of the country formed after world war two that is on occupied Palestinian land.
dictionary.more:
In the Quran the quote 'the Children of Israel' is read often but few people know that it means 'Descendants of Prophet Yaqoob'.

It is also rarely used as a name because Allah often mentions the descendants of Israel as sinners in the Quran, and the current political climate in the middle east makes it innapropriate since someone called Israel would be presumed to be a supporter of the illegal state.

dictionary.grammar: word; name of male; name of female;

Generally the word kafir means 'unbeliever' and it is not meant as a derogatory label (unless it is used against Muslims by another Muslim). Of course, there are different levels of Kufur (disbelief) so although a person may be correctly identified as a kafir, that person is not kafir in the strongest sense of the word. Absolute kufur is the rejection of God. Here are some examples of kufur:

(1) A person is known as a Kafir if they are disbelievers in Allah, in His Oneness, and in His final Messenger, Muhammad (SAW). (E.g. An apostate from Islam)
(2) A 'Muslim' who disbelieves in a necessary tenant of Islam like the 5 pillars or some other things is known as a disbeliever.
(3) An originally non-Muslim person who denies the religion of Islam while knowing in his heart that it is true.
(4) A disbeliever in Islam only because they originally follow another (monotheistic) faith.
(5) A person who follows another (monotheistic) faith and knows nothing about Islam.
(6) A person who believes in many gods (polytheist).
(7) An agnostic who is a monotheist is a lesser kafir than a polytheist.
(8) An Atheist (mulhid).

Generally a Christian or Jew is not identified as a kafir but they are known respectfully as Ahlul Kitab - People of the Book(s), and Islam considers their religions valid but once they find Islam they are expected to follow the updated covenant sent by God.
This plural word means 'unbelievers'. It is derived from the singular word 'kafir'.

Khalif (pronounced Khaleef) means successor. A Khalif is a leader of the Muslim Ummah (nation/peoples). After Prophet Muhammed (SAW) died there came after him numerous khalifs (successors) who were called Khalifs (Khaleefs).
dictionary.more:
The famous first four Khalifs are:

1 - Abu Bakr bin Abu Qahafa (RA)
2 - Umar bin al-Khataab (RA)
3 - Uthman bin Afaan (RA)
4 - Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS)

They are titled Al Khulafa' ar-Rashideen - The Rightly-guided Leaders.

Subsequent leaders were also called Khalifs as they had rulership of the whole Islamic Ummah (nation/peoples). Each khalif was titled 'Ameer al-Mu'mineen' (Commander of the Faithful) even though this title was given to Imam Ali by the Prophet exclusively. The Khilafah system ended with the end of the Ottman empire. There can be no more Khalifate until a new Islamic empire is re-born.

The Khalifate issue is quite controversial as the purpose of leadership was to manage the Muslim Ummah, yet the Prophet (SAW) did not commission a Khalif after him or organise a method of choosing the Khalifah. The Shia Muslims argue otherwise and state that the Prophet (SAW) chose Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS) to be the leader after his departure and his sons after him, as an order by Allah. This did not happen and as you can see in the list above Imam Ali ended up being the fourth khalif. There were five main methods of becoming khalif:

- Election by a small number of elite people
- Passing of leadership from Khalif to friend
- Passing of leadership from Khalif to son/decendant
- Murder of the khalif
- War imposed on the khalif by rebels (rebellion).

dictionary.meaning: The Muslim Ummah's (nation/peoples) Leadership. Also see Khalif.

This is a phrase that is mentioned in the Quran numerous times. The phrase by itself translates to "'Be', and it is" but its meaning is clearer in context:

Qur'an 36:82 - All He [God] needs to do to carry out any command is to say to it, "Be," and it is.

This shows the attribute of the power and omnipotence of God, but it does not mean that He created everything in an instance, because there are things he created in stages, such as the universe (7:54 etc).
dictionary.more:
kun = be/become

yakoon = it becomes/it is/it is possible.

dictionary.meaning:
Kunya is similar to the concept of a nick name. It's almost like the secondary name that people know you by and sometimes a persons kunya is more well known than their real name. Often, a kunya is more unique than a person's first name and is better to use for identification. In the time of the Prophet (SAW) and before, it was customary to have a kunya like Abu X, meaning Father of X, where X would be an invented
name of a person or object. The female equivalent is Umm X, Mother of X.
dictionary.more:
For example, Umar bin al Khatab, had the kunya of Abu Hafs, Father of Hafs, even though he didn't have a child by that name, nor did Abu Bakr, another companion, have a child called Bakr. It is not uncommon that a kunya be termed with something that is not a name. For example,
Abu Huraira, meaning father of the cat, may be a reference to that particular sahabi's (companion's) love of felines or ownership of them as pets, or in other cases it may be a reference to some sort of inside joke.

There is a hadith stating that the Prophet (SAW) said not to name people the same as his kunya. Some scholars interpret the hadith to be a strict order to never name a person with the same kunya that the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) had, while most others can see that the reason
the Prophet gave this advice was to reduce confusion during his lifetime to stop his person being mistook for someone else in conversation. This is the hadith:

Narrated by Anas Bin malik that the Prophet (SAW) was in the market when a man called another with "O Abu al-Qasim" so the prophet turned around answering thinking it was him whom that man meant. So the man said: I was calling another man (who had similar Kunya). Upon this the Prophet (SAW) said: "Name yourselves with my name (Muhammed) but do not have as my Kunya" [Sahih Bukhari].

dictionary.meaning: Luqman is the name of a Prophet of God.

Prophet Lot (in English) was Abraham's nephew. Allah sent him to a transgressing people who used to commit abominable acts such as steal from and murder travellers and indulge in their lusts with men rather than women (homosexuality).
dictionary.more: Lot frequently preached to them to abandon such heinous crimes and come to the right course of Allah, but they never obeyed him. Being disappointed in them, Lot prayed to Allah to destroy them, but save the believers among them. Because Lot's wife was apparently not a believer, her previous sympathy for the sinful people destined her to a miserable end along with her people.

dictionary.meaning: A girl's name meaning kindness.

dictionary.more: Madhhabs arrise due to different interpretations  of the Quran, Sunnah and for political reasons. The word madhhab and sect can be thought of in the same way usually, but there is a difference because there can be different mathhabs within the same sect. Examples of Mathhabs include Shia, Sunni, wahabi, salafi, deobandi etc. A muslim should not follow a mathhab when it contradicts clear proof in the Quran and Sunnah.

It was previously called Yathrib but was changed to 'Madina al-Munawarah' (The Illuminated City) in honor of the Prophet's arrival. It was thus called Madina from thereon as the short form of the name. Madina lies north of Makkah.

(2) It is also the name of one of the compulsory (wajib) prayers which is often prayed after the sun has descended.
(3) The Arabic name of the country of Morocco.
dictionary.more: The word maghrib comes from the root word ghuroob which means 'setting'. The country of Morocco was called Maghrib as the other root word 'gharb' means 'west' as it is the west-most Muslim country.

He is yet to be born according to the majority of Sunni Muslims, but is alive at this very moment according to the majority of Shia Muslims, but his identity is not know (i.e. He is in occulation).

It is said he will accompany Prophet Jesus (AS) when he returns and will rid the world of evil, eventually bringing peace and harmony after the great wars.

Mahdi is also a popular boy's name.

The mahr is an amount of money or property that is given to the wife by the husband as a non-returnable dowry in the marriage contract. She may use it as she wishes.

A mahram is a male, whom a woman can never marry because of close relationship (e.g. a brother, a father, a sibling); The mahram can be thought of as a guardian she can call upon when neccessary if she is not married, but if she is then her own husband is her mahram when he is available. A woman need not wear hijab in front of her mahram and a mahram is usually needed for travelling long distances in safety.
A ma'ida is a large feast, a table spread. The fifth chapter of the Qur'an is named Al-Mai'da.

The Arabic form of this popular girls' name is 'maryam'.
dictionary.more: "Mary", written the same way it sounds in English is ماري.

dictionary.meaning: Maryam is the Arabic word for the name Mary. Maryam (AS) was the mother of Prophet Isa (Jesus) (PBUH). Maryam is regarded as being one of the four greatest women in creation (with Asiyah, Khadijah and Fatimah). Maryam is a very popular girl's name.
An Arabic word meaning to wipe or wiping of.
Masa'il is a plural word meaning 'questions'. The singular is su'al.
Masajid is a plural word meaning Mosques (Muslim places of worship). A single mosque is known as a Masjid.
See Ma'asalama.
A Christian.
dictionary.more: A Jew is known as a yahoodi.

dictionary.meaning: masha'allah, pronounced ma-sha'-llah, literally means 'Whatever Allah (God) wills'. It is often used in occasions where there is surprise in someones' good deeds or achievements. For example people say masha'allah when someone does very well in their exams.
A building designated for prayer. Called "Mosque" in English.

The word ma'soom is often equated with the English word Infallible which means incapable of error. However, people who are described as ma'soom do not make errors or commit sins, but they have the ability to make errors and commit sins.
dictionary.more: Many Muslims believe the Prophets (PBUT) to be ma'soom.

dictionary.meaning: Ma'soomeen is a plural word meaning infallibles - persons free from sin. The singular word is ma'soom.
Mas'oud is a boy's name meaning blissful or content.
Masr is another pronunciation of the word Misr, which is the Arabic name for the country of Egypt.
Delighted.
Matthew is an English name meaning 'Gift of God'.
The plural of mawrid, and it means 'sources'.
Lord, Master, Helper, Protector, Supporter, Patron. Not usually used in referance to God.
dictionary.more: Also see wali.

dictionary.meaning: A form of address to a ruler or person of authority implying protector.
Birth or birthday.
Source.
Death.
A boy's name meaning rain cloud.
The Arabic word for meat is Laham.
See Makkah.
Birth day.
A weighing scale used to measure weights. In Islam the meezan is a hypothetical scale used to measure good deeds against bad deeds on Judgement day.
dictionary.more:
The following surah (chapter), The Calamity, from the Quran mentions the concept of weighing of deeds on the scales:
[101.1] The terrible calamity!
[101.2] What is the terrible calamity!
[101.3] And what will make you comprehend what the terrible calamity is?
[101.4] The day on which men shall be as scattered moths,
[101.5] And the mountains shall be as loosened wool.
[101.6] Then as for him whose measure of good deeds is heavy,
[101.7] He shall live a pleasant life.
[101.8] And as for him whose measure of good deeds is light,
[101.9] His abode shall be the abyss.
[101.10] And what will make you know what it is?
[101.11] A burning fire.

dictionary.meaning: See Letter.
Michael is the name of an Angel known as Mikaeel in Arabic.
dictionary.more: The transliteral spelling of michael is مايكل.

dictionary.meaning: A mihrab is commonly found in traditional mosques. It is a prayer niche where the Imam stands to lead the prayers and it shows the direction of the Qibla. It is usually built by digging out a concave pillar shape from the wall. It is then decorated in all sorts of beautiful Islamic art designs.

Mikaeel (Michael) is the name of one of God's very important Angels. One thing he is known for is bringing a plate of heavens' fruits to Prophet Muhammed (SAW) the night Fatimah (AS), the Prophet's daughter, was conceived.
See Meelad.
From.
Min fadhlek is the Arabic phrase for "please".
During Hajj (pilgramage) the town of Mina must be visited. It is about five miles away from Makkah.

A minbar is an object commonly found in traditional mosques. The Imam of the Mosque goes up the stairs and sits (or stands) from the seat at the top so that he can preach a sermon. It is a lot like a pulpit which is found in traditional Christian churches.
dictionary.more: Minbars come in different designs but the most common are wooden ones that have Islamic art carved into them.

dictionary.meaning: A path or road or a curriculum.
