Mir (pronounced Meer) is a contraction of the Arabic word Ameer and is used amongst speakers of Farsi, Urdu and related languages. It means Master or General and is used nowadays as a respectful title or a prefix to a given name, rather than describing a rank or authority.

Mi'raj literally means ladder, but in Islamic history it refers to the Isra' and Mi'raj journeys undertook by the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). One night during the Islamic month of Rajab the Prophet was taken on a two-part journey accompanied by the angel Gabrial. The first part, the Israa', was to be taken from Makkah to Jerusalem, and the second part, the Mi'raj, was an ascension into the heavens, where he met past Prophets, was shown the different levels of heaven and hell and other wonderous things.
Lantern or torch.
A person is described as being miskeen if they are poor & needy, in need of certain necessities to stop them from going hungry and/or perishing.
Misr is the Arabic name used for the country of Egypt.

The miswak is the natural equivalent of the toothbrush. It is a short twig with frayed bristles that is used to brush the teeth and it is made from the twigs of the Salvadora persica (Peelu or Arak) tree.
dictionary.more: The Prophet (SAW) highly recommended using the miswak to clean the teeth. The miswak has a natural anti-bacterial effect and decreases tooth decay and improves the odour of the mouth. It is recommended to use the miswaq (even if you have a modern toothbrush) before praying as it is stated in hadith that the reward for the prayer will be increased 70-fold.

dictionary.meaning: See Muhammed.
The Arabic word for moon is 'Qamar'. A crescent moon is known as a 'hilal'.
See Musa.
The Arabic word for 'more' is Akthar.

Official Name: Kingdom of Morocco.
In Arabic, the country is called 'Maghrib'.
dictionary.more: Capital: Rabat.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for mosque is masjid.
The Arabic word for mother is 'umm'. See Umm for more information.
dictionary.more:
To say 'Your mother' to a man, you say 'ummek'.
To say 'Your mother' to a woman, you say 'ummik'.

dictionary.meaning: Mu'alim is the Arabic word for teacher.
dictionary.more: Another word for teacher is ustadh.

dictionary.meaning: Muawiyah was one of the companions (sahabah) of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). He managed to become the fifth (or sixth) Khalif (leader) after rebelling against the leadership of Imam Ali (AS) and taking the throne as leader of the Muslim Ummah (nation). Muawiyah had a son called Yazid who Muawiyah made the Khalif after him.

Mubah is one of the classifications of an action according to Islamic Jurisprudence (fiqh). It means 'permitted based on individuals whim'. This category is left undecided and without a ruling by scholar so it is left for the person to decide for themselves if they do things such as eating apples or oranges. Doing or not doing the Mubah does not count as a good or bad deed.
Blessed.
The feminine form of the word mubarak, which means blessed.

(1) When mubashir is pronounced with an emphasis on the 'sh' sound, it means 'a spreader of good news'.
(2) When pronounced with an elongation of the 'a' vowel it means 'live', as in - "now showing live on CNN".
(3) Mubashar, where an 'a' is pronounced instead of an 'i' before the end of the word and with an emphasis on the 'sh' sound means foretold or destined (to be blessed with good tidings).
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown above is for the first and third meanings - the difference in pronunciation is achieved through diacritics. The second word is spelled like so: مباشر.

dictionary.meaning: A muedhin is a person who does the call to prayer, the Athan. This call to prayer is said loudly so that others become aware that the congretional prayers are about to begin.
One who helps. Al-Mu'een is one of God's attributes/names.
See Muedhin.
A word meaning preferred.
A person who spreads corruption is called a mufsid.
A group of people who spread corruption are called mufsideen. A single spreader of corruption is called a mufsid.

A mufti is a person who presents the laws and fiqh of the scholars to people who ask for them. They should not give their own opinion but they should present the arguments and laws of the maraje' (grand Muftis or Ayatollahs). Most muftis are found in Saudi Arabia, Egypt and Iran. The word mufti is derived from the word fatwa and it means 'one who gives fatwas'.
dictionary.more: A mufti cannot allow people to follow his own opinions, but the mufti can follow his own opinions. A grand Mufti is a higher ranking Mufti that is followed by a large group of people. This is a lot like an Ayatollah found in Shia Islam. Some countries have their own Mufti to decree the opinion of the state.

dictionary.meaning: A muhajir is a person who emmigrates or has emmigrated - an immigrant.
dictionary.more: After the Muslims suffered great hardships, exclusion and torture in Makkah, the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) received instruction from God to emmigrate to Madina with his followers. The Muslims who emmigrated to Madina were called the "Muhajiroon", while the Muslim residents of Madina were called the Ansar (supporters).

dictionary.meaning: Muhajiroon, Immigrants, is the plural of muhajir.
dictionary.more: The Muslims who emmigrated from Makkah to Madina to escape persecution were called the muhajiroon.

dictionary.meaning: A woman who is veiled - wears a hijab.

The name of the final Prophet of Islam. He is deeply revered and is always given a blessing after mention of his name - peace be upon him - which is given acronyms like (SAW) or (PBUH). Many Muslims use the name for their male children.
dictionary.more: We have to know and understand who this man (Muhammed) is, for it is through him the final revelation descended from the Lord and it is through him we will know more than just what Islam is or what religion is. It is through him we will discover who Allah (God) is and thus who we are, our purpose or goal in this life and how to achieve enlightenment.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Muharram is the first month of the Islamic Calendar. This month is considered a month of mourning by the Shia (and many Sunni) Muslims due to the murder of the Grandson of Prophet Muhammed (SAW), Imam Hussain (AS).
(2) Muharram can mean 'made forbidden'.
dictionary.more: Muharram is so-called because it was the main month designated by the pre-Islam Arabs as a month where war was forbidden. They didn't usually follow their own rules and they even made an agreement where they would observe the law on year and the next year they could fight.  They also broke this agreement too.

dictionary.meaning: A popular boy's name meaning beneficent.
The plural of Mujahid.
A person who does Jihad.
One who responds. One of God's names is Al-Mujeeb - the one who responds to prayers.
A word meaning the chosen one.
A Mujtahid is a very educated Muslim who is qualified to discern his own ruling on the permissibility of an Islamic law, but only for himself.
Fighter (not military).
An atheist - one who disbelieves in the existance of God.
A mu'min is a faithful and religious believer in Islam and its laws.
Mu'mineen is the plural of the word "Mu'min". It means '(devout) believers'.

(1) Possible, or Yes you can.
(2) Can I..., or Is is possible...
Excellent or brilliant.
A popular girl's name meaning wish or desire.
Hypocrite.
Plural of hypocrite - Many hypocrites.

Munawarrah means illuminated. Al Madina al Munawarah in Saudi Arabia is the illuminated city that Prophet Muhammed (SAW) emigrated to and it was called the illuminated city in honor of the Prophet coming to it. It was previously known as Yathrib.

(1) Doing munkar is doing an action associated with wrong-doing, evil-doing, sins, polytheism, disbelief, etc.
(2) Munkar is the name of one of two Angels (Munkar & Nakir) who question people in their graves. This is done while a person is in the state of barzakh.
A boundary or end of some sort, or the farthest end of a contained area.
dictionary.more: See Sidratul Muntaha.

dictionary.meaning: Muqawama means active resistance against aggression.
Muraqabah comes from the word raqib, which means to follow, watch, keep tags-on.
A murtad is a person who leaves the religion (apostacy) and conspires against it.
Murtadha, sometimes spelled 'Murtaza', is a popular boy's name. It means agreeable.
Prophet Moses' name in Arabic.
dictionary.more: Moses was sent to call Pharaoh (the ruler of Egypt) and his people to believe in the Oneness of Allah. He was strengthened by a number of miracles. Allah instructed Moses to throw down his staff which miraculously turned into a huge snake and swallowed all the snakes which the magicians of Pharaoh had made appear. Moses was also instructed to put his hand in his pocket, and it came forth radiantly white, without stain. The Pharaoh promised severe punishments to the followers of Moses. Moses was commanded to leave Egypt with his people (the Jews) by night. Moses's followers were to cross the Red Sea towards Sinai in a huge procession. They were reassured not to fear the Pharaoh, nor the sea, nor the vast unknown desert of Sinai into which they were venturing. They crossed the Red Sea - after Moses struck the sea with his miraculous staff and it split into dry passage - while the Pharaoh, who had pursued them with his troops, was overwhelmed by the sea and perished.

dictionary.meaning: Music.

(1) Any Book, even ones that are not religious.
(2) A copy of the Quran. This is the most common meaning.
An advisor.
Polytheist, pagan, idolater, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah, a person who worships others along with Allah, and also those who set up rivals with (or partners to) Allah.
See Mushrikoon.
Polytheists, pagans, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, those who worship others along with Allah, and also those who set up rivals with (or partners to) Allah.
dictionary.more: Mushrikoon is the same as Mushrikeen.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for musiq is 'Museeqah'.

dictionary.grammar: Word or Name; genderless in english; male in arabic (fem.:muslimah);
dictionary.meaning:
(1) A follower of the religion of Islam.
(2) A person who submits their will to God and believes in Him.
A female follower of the religion of Islam.
dictionary.more: Often the 'h' on the end of the word is not pronounced and it is therefore written as muslima as well.

dictionary.meaning: A girl's name meaning foretold or destined (to be blessed with good news or tidings).
See Mutapha.

A recommended form of worship or action. Doing a mustahab activity will be rewarded by Allah but not doing a Mustahab activity will not be considered sinful. E.g. Reading Quran daily.
Most mustahab acts have greater benefit/reward (thawab) than mandatory (wajib) activities.
Mustapha, sometimes spelled 'Mustafa', is a popular boy's name. It is one of Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) names. It means 'guided' as Muhammed is the guided one.
The future.
Upright/straight.

A pious and righteous person who fears Allah much (abstains from all kinds of sins and evil deeds which Allah has forbidden) and loves Allah much (performs all kinds of good deeds which Allah and his Messenger (SAW) have ordained).

In the study of Islamic narrations, hadiths, a mutawattir hadith is one which is narrated by such a large number of people and in a consistent manner that it is practically impossible that it is false or has been planted there in numerous sources through some kind of conspiracy.
dictionary.more:
Its conditions include:

(1) That it be narrated by a large number of people. Scholars differ about the actual number required
(2) That this number is found in every level of the isnaad (chain of transmission)
(3) That it is impossible that they could have gathered together upon a lie.

dictionary.meaning: Mutma'in means certain, sure or confident.
dictionary.more: Ana mutma'in - I am certain.

dictionary.meaning: Purified (ritually).
See Mutaqoon.

Pious and righteous persons who fear Allah much (abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds which Allah has forbidden) and love Allah much (perform all kinds of good deeds which Allah and his Messenger (SAW) have ordained).
A person who declares the singleness of God is known as a muwahid - a monotheist.
One who wraps himself up or enshrouds himself (in blankets).
dictionary.more: It is said that after receiving the first revelation from angel Gabrial, the Prophet Muhammed (SAW), full of adrenaline, quickly got back home and wrapped himself up in his blankets. Thus God calls upon him as Al-Muzzammil in chapter 73 of the Quran.

dictionary.meaning:
There is no direct Arabic word for 'my'. Instead, to identify something as a possesion of your own, you add an 'i' after the word.
For example, the sentance 'Hatha kelb' means 'This is a dog'. If the sentance is altered to 'Hatha kelbi' it means 'This is my dog'.
"My Name is ..." is "Ismee ..." in Arabic.
Yes.
It means fire but is usually used in referance to the fires of hell (Jahanam).
Naas is the plural of the word insan. Naas means 'people'.
A boy's name meaning noble.
Prophet.
A popular girl's name meaning announcer or caller.
A popular girl's name meaning precious.

Nafillah is the name given to a set of defined mustahab (recommended) prayers that precede the 5 wajib (obligatory) daily prayers. There is also a nafillah prayer that precedes the recommended tahujjud prayer, so effectively it is a mustahab prayer that becomes part of another mustahab prayer.
Soul or self.
Peak. Nahj usually comes in a sentance as part of the title of a famous book called Nahj al Balaghah - The Peak of Eloquence. This book contains beautifully worded sermons narrated by Imam Ali (AS).
A bee. Chapter 16 of the Quran is named Al-Nahl - The Bee.
dictionary.more: The word is pronounced like "Nahil".

dictionary.meaning: Al-Najaf is a city in Iraq. The grave of Ali ibn Abu Talib (AS) is located there.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is Al-Najaf as the city is called.

dictionary.meaning: Najah means success, and it has been used as a boy's name.

An impurity - something that will cause a person to become ritually impure and require some type of ritual wash to make the individual 'clean' again. For example, urine is a source of najasah. Urine is najis.
A popular boy's name meaning of noble birth.
Ritually impure/unclean. eg. Blood and urine are najis.
A star.
Nakir is the name of one of the two Angels (Nakir and Munkar) who question a person in their graves when they die and they are in the state of Barzakh.
Namaz is the Urdu word for Prayer. It is used by a large number of non-Arabic speakers and even by people who do not speak Urdu. In Arabic, prayer is known as salat.
The Arabic word for 'name' is 'isim'.
A girl's name meaning pure.
See Naar.
A girl's name after a flower, the Narcissus/Daffodil.
See Naas.
See Nasir.

A religiously themed song, much like a song of praise, but usually sung without any musical instruments accompanying the performance. Often background tone is derived from numerous people mimicking instruments by humming in tune.
Nasir means 'one who is victorious'. It is a popular boy's name.
dictionary.more: Other forms and spellings of this word are Naseer, Naser and Nasser.

dictionary.meaning: Victory.
See Nasir.
Nathan is an English name meaning 'Gift of God'.
dictionary.more: Pronounced 'Na-than' in the Arabic form.

dictionary.meaning: This phrase means 'We seek refuge in Allah (from evil)'. Without the n at the beginning it means 'I seek refuge in Allah (from evil)'. It is a short form of a longer phrase: Naudhubillah min al-Shaytan al-Rajeem - I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan.
The name of an optional prayer recited during the month of ramadhan.
An Asian name meaning sapphire.
See Niyyah.
Emerging to freedom.
Niah (or nia) means intention.
The Arabic word for nice is Hilloo.
Hypocracy.
The Arabic word for night is 'Layl'.
Islamic marriage.
Nikkah means Marriage.
dictionary.more: Another word is zawaj.

dictionary.meaning: A piece of cloth that covers the face except the eye. It is an addition to the standard hijab and is mainly practiced by women in Saudia Arabia and those who follow the Wahabi beliefs.
dictionary.more: From Sahih Bukhari 6:282 - 'Aisha used to say: "When (the Verse): 'They should draw their veils over their necks and bosoms,' was revealed, (the ladies) cut their waist sheets at the edges and covered their faces with the cut pieces". Although the majority of Muslim women don't wear the niqab, there is nothing wrong with wearing it. It is not a mandatory (wajib) part of hijab by the views of the majority of scholars.

dictionary.meaning: Nisaa' means Women. One of the chapters of the Qur'an is called al-Nisaa'.

Nisab is the minimum amount of zakat-taxable wealth a Muslim has to own before they are required to pay the Zakat tax. Muslims who are poor or who have less than the nisab amount or have few zakat-taxable assets are exempt from paying the Zakat.
dictionary.more:
The Nisab value is primarily based on the value of pure gold. If a Muslim has zakat-taxable wealth exceeding the value of 85g of gold then they are required to pay the Zakat that year. Once tax is given on this wealth it is not taxable again.

The Nisab is valued differently based on the type(s) of wealth owned and there are specific rulings based on various conditions so it is best to refer to a scholar for guidance.

dictionary.meaning: Forgetfulness.
See Niyyah.

Niyyah means 'intention'. If someone intends to do a good deed but his actions are cut short due to no fault of his/her own, then they still get the thawab (plus points) for it as if they had succeeded.
The English word 'No' in Arabic is 'La'.

dictionary.grammar: English word; name of male; Prophet;
dictionary.meaning: Noah (PBUH) is a Prophetic name. The Arabic form of this name is Nuh (pronounced Nooh).
See Nuh.
Light. Noor is also a popular girl's name.
The name Noora is a very popular girls' name. The name is related to the word 'noor' which means light.
See Noora.

Nuh (also spelled Nooh) (PBUH) is a Prophet of God known as Noah in English. His people continually disobeyed him and refused to worship God so He sent them a flood and killed the people in that valley. Nuh, his family (except for his son and wife) and some animals escaped the flood and were saved because God had instructed them to build an Ark.
See Noor.
A boy's name meaning small/young servant or slave - it has its origins in pre-Islamic Arabia where slavery was common. Modern namings assume the meaning Obaidullah - Small/Young Servant of God.
Small/Young Servant of God.
See Umar.
See umar.
The Arabic word for 'one' is wahid.

Osama was the son of Prophet Muhammed's foster son Zayd ibn Harith (RA). Osama grew up to become a young military general who led the last battle during the life of the Prophet against Byzantine troops in the north.
See Uthman.

Owais Qarni is person who became a Muslim during the lifetime of the Prophet Muhammed though he never got a chance to meet him in person. He fought alongside Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib (AS) in the battle of Siffin against Mu'awiyyah where he was martyred.
The Arabic word for owl is boomah.
Pak is an Urdu/Persian word meaning ritually pure. The Arabic word is 'tahir'.
dictionary.more: Although it is an Urdu word it is used by all sorts of people who are not Arab. Even the Persians use this word. The first letter of the word is not native to the Arabic language, so it is usually replaced with the Arabic 'baa' letter. The true type version shown is with the persion 'pe' letter.

dictionary.meaning: Palestine is a country in the Middle East and is currently occupied by the illegitimate state of Israel. Arabs call this country philisteen.
The common English word used to refer to Jannah.
The name of an ancient Persian King meaning success.
The Arabic word for patience is sabr.
Paul is an English name meaning 'Small'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic language has no letter 'p', so 'b' is used instead. The word sounds like bawl which means urine in Arabic.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for peace is 'Salam'. Salam is also the Muslim greeting, like Hello.

'Peace Be Upon Him' is an English phrase that is said as a sign of respect after mentioning a Prophet. Islam requires we love and respect all the Prophets and saying this after their name is one sign of reverance. The common acronym for this phrase is (PBUH).
Peter is an English name meaning 'Rock or Stone'.
dictionary.more: Since the Arabic language doesn't have a 'p', the letter 'b' will be used instead.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for someone who has made pilgrimage (hajj) to Makkah is 'hajji' if they are male, or 'hijjiyah' if they are female.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for hajji. The female form is حجيه.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for pilgrimage is 'Hajj'.
The Arabic phrase for "please" is "min fadhlek".
The Arabic word for power (strength) is 'quwah' or (energy) 'taqeh'.

(1) To Salli (verb), (do salat) - This is the ritual prayer of the Muslims which must be done 5 times a day.
(2) To ad'i (verb), (do Dua) - This is a supplication to God where a Muslim asks God for something or repents for sins. Hands are opened palm-up and (sometimes) raised during this prayer.
dictionary.more: The verb form of these words are rarely used in English Islamic literature due to the spelling and the fact that most non-Arabic speaking Muslims know these prayer types by their noun forms.

dictionary.meaning:
There are two words for prayer in Arabic - they are different types of prayer:
(1) Salat - the defined and organised prayer, 5 of which are obligatory daily.
(2) Du`a' - unregulated personal supplication to God.
dictionary.more: The Arabic word shown is for Salat.

dictionary.meaning: See Beautiful.
The Arabic word for Prophet is 'nabi'.
The Psalms are known as the 'Zaboor' in Arabic. They are a revelation from God given to Prophet Dawood (David) (PBUH).

This Urdu word means curtains. It can refer to a seperating curtain that is placed between men and women's areas in a mixed location. It allowes the men and women to get on with their work without the women having to wear hijab in front of the men.
The Arabic word for pure is 'safi' or 'tahir' depending on its usage.
A grave.
Qabeel, also spelled Qabil, is known as Cain in the bible, and he was the son of Prophet Adam (PBUH). He murdered his brother Habeel (Abel).
Grave.
Old or ancient. In philosophy the word 'Qadeem', when talking about God, means 'eternal'.
A judge.
A popular boy's name meaning capable and strong.

(1) Qadr means predestination, fate or destiny. In Islam it is a necessary belief to have that God knows the fate of all creatures. It is also believed that people's lives and actions are determined by God (to some extent). Most Muslims believe in a mixture of both fate and free-will for all creatures.
(2) Qadr can also mean power or potential.
dictionary.more:
There is a Surah (Chapter) in the Quran that is known as Al-Qadr.
In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
[97.1] Surely We revealed it on the grand night. (The night of Qadr)
[97.2] And what will make you comprehend what the grand night
[97.3] The grand night is better than a thousand months.
[97.4] The angels and Gibreel descend in it by the permission of their Lord for every affair,
[97.5] Peace! it is till the break of the morning.

dictionary.meaning: Qahar means Creator. Al-Qahar, The Creator, is one of the names of God.

A Qalam (pron. Qelem) is either a pen or pencil.
Qalam Hibir = Ink Pen.
Qalam Risas = Pencil.
See Qelb.
The Moon.
Qamoos is the Arabic word for dictionary.
Qareeb means close, related or soon.

A castle or palace.

Were you looking for the word ".

Qasr literally means shortened or reduced and in Islam it refers to reducing the number of rak`as (see ruku`) in prayer. A Muslim is required to shorten some of their prayers when they are travelling.
dictionary.more: When a Muslim is travelling outside of their home town a certain distance (more than 28 miles of travelling and not staying longer than 10 days at their new destination), for prayers which require four rak'as, they now need to pray two raka`as instead. The worshipper makes the intention to pray Salat Qasr when they are going to pray the Dhuhr, 'Asr and 'Isha` prayers and they finish the prayer in two rak'as, just like they would with the fajr prayers. The other two prayers, Fajr and Maghrib are unmodified.

dictionary.meaning: An old Arab boy's name meaning firm.
The heart.
The direction that Muslims pray - facing towards the Kaaba.
dictionary.more:
The Qiblah used to be Jerusalem (al-Quds) but was later changed to Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) birth place because Muhammed wished that from Allah and it was granted.
Compasses with directions in little booklets are used to determine the direction of the Qiblah usually, but there also exists many electronic gadgets and mobile phone apps that are now being produced that do the work of the compass more accuratly and with less effort.

dictionary.meaning: Gambling.
Cat (feminine).
Fighting, battle or war.
The act of rising. Specifically, this refers to the Day of Judgement, where we shall all be raised - be resurrected.
Holy. One of God's names/attributes is Al-Qudoos - The Most Holy.
Qudsi means holy, or pure. There are some reports from the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) where he relates to the people what God has said or did, but this information is not part of the Qur'an.
dictionary.more:
While the common factor between hadith qudsi and the Qur'an is that both contain words from Allah which have been revealed to Muhammad (SAW), the main points of difference between Qur'an and hadith qudsi are as follows:

* In the Qur'an the precise wording is from Allah, while in the hadith qudsi the wording is given by the Prophet Muhammad.
* The Qur'an has been brought to Muhammad (SAW) only by the Angel Gabriel (AS), while hadith qudsi may also have been inspired otherwise, such as e.g. in a dream.
* The Qur'an is inimitable and unique, but not so the hadith qudsi.
* The Qur'an has been transmitted by numerous persons, (tawatur) but the hadith and hadith qudsi often only by a few or even one individual. There are hadith qudsi which are sahih, but also others hasan, or even dhaeef, while there is no doubt at all about any ayah from the Qur'an.

Hadith qudsi cannot be recited in prayer.

dictionary.meaning: Qunoot is raising the hands during prayer to the level of the mouth and making a short dua. This is usually done before the second ruk'a. It is a way to ask Allah for your needs directly inside of salat and it can be said in your native language - not just Arabic.

An Islamic scripture believed by Muslims to be God's (Allah's) revelation to the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). It is believed to be the exact, unadulterated words of Allah. It is written in Arabic. The word quran is derived from the Arabic verb qaraa (to recite or to read). Commonly written as Koran or Qur'an.
dictionary.more:
The Qur'an is a Message from Allah to humanity. It was transmitted to us in a chain starting from the Almighty Himself, to the angel Gabriel to the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). This message was given to the Prophet in pieces over a period spanning approximately 23 years (610 CE to 622 CE). The Prophet (SAW) was 40 years old when the Qur'an began to be revealed to him, and he was 63 when the revelation was completed. The language of the original message was Arabic, but it has been translated into many other languages.

The Qur'an is one leg of two which form the basis of Islam. The second leg is the Sunnah of the Prophet (SAW). What makes the Qur'an different from the Sunnah is primarily its form. Unlike the Sunnah, the Qur'an is quite literally the Word of Allah, whereas the Sunnah was inspired by Allah but the wording and actions are the Prophet's. The Qur'an has not been expressed using any human's words. Its wording is letter for letter fixed by no one but Allah.

Prophet Muhammed (SAW) was the final Messenger of Allah to humanity, and therefore the Qur'an is the last Message which Allah has sent to us. Its predecessors such as the Torah, Psalms, and Gospels have all been superceded. It is an obligation - and blessing - for all who hear of the Qur'an and Islam to investigate it and evaluate it for themselves. Allah has guaranteed that He will protect the Qur'an from human tampering, and today's readers can find exact copies of it all over the world. The Qur'an of today is the same as the Qur'an revealed to Muhammad (SAW) almost 1400 years ago.

dictionary.meaning: A girl's name meaning soothing/joyous to the eyes.
Qutaybah is an old Arab boy's name (although it resembles a girl's name) that comes from the word Qutb which means axis, origin or pole.
Qutb is an old Arab boy's name meaning axis, origin or pole.
Strength or power.
Lord or God. There are various spellings in English of this word but they all sound the same.
Lord or Deity.
Rabbi, pronounced 'rabbee', means 'My Lord'.
Rabee' is the season of Spring.
Rabee'a is a popular girl's name coming from the word for spring, rabee'.
See Rabbi.
A head scarf.

Radhiallah Anhum (plural) or Rathiallah Anh (singular) means 'May Allah be pleased with them (or him)'. It is often represented by the acronym (RA). It is added after the names of the sahabah (companions) and wives of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) as a sign of respect.
Ra'ees is a title meaning president, leader or chief.
Friend. This is also a popular boy's name.
Rahbar is a Farsi (Iranian/Persian) word meaning Leader.
Al Raheem is a name of God. It means Allah is merciful to the believers.
A girl's name meaning traveller.
Rahma means mercy. One of the names of God is Al-Rahman - the Most Merciful.
Al Rahman is one of the names of God. It means merciful & beneficent to all His creations.
Ra'ina is an old Arabic word use to draw attention meaning listen to us or hearken to us. With a twist in the pronunciation it can mean our sheep herder.
dictionary.more:
This word is found the Qur'an and the common translation of the verse it is found in is: [2.104] O you who have believed, say not [to Allah 's Messenger], "Ra'ina" but say, "Unthurna" and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

As a translation this is not very useful as they haven't attempted to translate the meaning of the words Ra'ina or Undhurna.

Ra'ina is equivalent in meaning to 'have regard for us' or 'give us your ear' or hearken, or 'listen to us', but with a slight twist of the accent the meaning of this word changes and becomes the word for livestock tender - a person who looks after sheep or cows and considered uneducated and unintelligent. The Jews and Pagans used to insult the Holy Prophet (SAW) using it. Therefore, Allah commanded the Muslims to use the clear word Undhurna, which means 'grant us some delay' or 'wait for us' when speaking with the Prophet. It is much more respectful and cannot be twisted.

dictionary.meaning: The seventh month of the Islamic calendar.
The word rajeem means accursed. Satan, the devil, is often called 'Al-Shaitan al-rajeem' as he is the accursed one.
A Rak'a is a single act of Ruku'. See Ruku.

Ramadhan is a special month in the Islamic calendar. During this month the Muslims refrain from eating and drinking during daylight hours (called fasting [sawm]) and they also seek to improve themselves by sinning less and praying more.

The phrase Ramadhan Kareem means "(May you have a) Generous (month of) Ramadhan". Muslims say this to each other during the holy month of Ramadhan. It is a popular phrase but not as popular as the most common "Ramadhan Mubarak".
Ramadhan Mubarak is a common greeting phrase that Muslims say to each other during the holy month of Ramadhan. This is the month of fasting. The phrase means: Have a blessed month of Ramadhan.
Symbol.
A popular girl's name meaning 'to gaze'.
An old Arab girl's name meaning Queen.
Ra'oof means Merciful and kind. Al-Ra'oof is one of the names/attributes of God.
Rasheed is a popular boy's name meaning mature/wise.

Rasool means Messenger. Prophet Muhammed (PBUH), amongst others, was a Messenger from Allah (God). A Messenger from Allah is a special type of Prophet as he brings a new book/scripture and law (sharia).

Rasoolollah means 'Messenger of Allah (God)'. This is one of the titles of a Messenger Prophet - A Prophet who is sent with a Message (usually a scripture) is known as a Rasool (Messenger). You will often find this word in one line of the Adhan - the call to prayer: Ash-hadu ana Muhammadun Rasoolollah - I bear witness that Muhammed is the Messenger of Allah.
See Rasoolollah.
Pronounced Reyhan this name comes from a selection of aromatic herbs that give off a fragrant scent. The word can be found in the Quran in two places - 55:12 and 56:89.
An old Arab girl's name meaning antelope. The name Reem is also popular.
The Arabic word for 'religion' is 'deen'.
See Ridha.
See Ribba.
Ribba means 'interest'. Interest is when an individual gives more money back to the lender than originally borrowed. It is forbidden to take interest in Islam.
dictionary.more: Person A needs a loan - say £20. He goes to person B and asks him for it. Person B lends him the money but seeks interest at 20% when the person pays him back later. Person A agrees and takes the £20 from B. A month later person A needs to pay back person B, so he gives him back his money (£20) as well as the interest (20% * £20 = £4); So in total he gave £24 to person B, and person B is £4 richer. This is called ribba and is not permitted in Islam.

dictionary.meaning: A popular boy's name meaning satisfied (with what Allah has blessed him with).

The Arabic words for right are:
(1) Right, as in "right handed" is 'yameen'.
(2) Right, as in "that's the right answer" is 'sah'.
(3) Right, as in "I have the right to a lawyer" is 'haq'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for (2).

dictionary.meaning: A journey or voyage.
A letter or statement. Some scholars write statements that explain their teachings and ideas in general so that individuals can read them and decide whether to follow them (taqleed).
See Riyya.

Riyya' is to show off that you are a good Muslim or a devout believer in front of others just to look good in front of them while your intention is not to please Allah but instead to make yourself look better in the eyes of other people. It is a form of deceiving people and is not permitted in Islam.
dictionary.more: An example of riyya is when a person shows off that they've given a lot of money to charity in front of others and they have done this in order to gain the reputation of being a charitable person in the community. The teachings of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) state that riyya is approaching idolatry as your niyyah, or intention, is for yourself and others and not for Allah who should be foremost in who we aim to please.

dictionary.meaning: Rizq is earnings, profit or wealth.
Robert is an English name meaning 'bright fame'.
dictionary.more: Pronounced 'ro-bart' in Arabic.

dictionary.meaning: Rooh means Soul.
Roza is an Urdu word which means fasting. The Arabic word for fasting is sawm.
See Rabb.
See Rooh.

The ruku' is a form of prostration done in prayer. It is like a half prostration. It is initiated from a standing upright position and it precedes the sujood (complete prostration). The person bends their body forward at the hip and with their outstretched arms they reach to place their hands on their knees. Some words are said "subhana rabbial adheema wa bihamdih" (Most glorious is the Mighty Lord and He is Merciful), then the act is complete and the person rises back to stand in the upright position.
dictionary.more:
The ascii-art stick figure below represents this move. The forward slash represents the arms.
---o
|/
|.

dictionary.meaning: A popular girl's name that originates from the word raqeeq which means gentle, delicate or soft. It is an old Arab name.
Dance or Dancing.

(1) Saad is a letter of the Arabic alphabet. In words it sounds much like the English letter 's' but with more of a whistle sound. One of the Surahs (chapters) of the Quran is called Saad.
(2) Sa'ad is a popular boy's name meaning happiness.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is the name sa'ad.

dictionary.meaning: Sa'adah means happiness.
Sabah means morning. It is also used as a boy's name.
The Arabic phrase for "Good Morning".

(1) A person who is waiting for something to happen is said to be sabir.
(2) Or a person described as being patient at the current moment is said to be sabir.
dictionary.more: The person would only be described as saboor if he/she was patient most of the time, or it was a trait of their character.

dictionary.meaning: The word saboor is used to describe someone who is often patient, or patient by nature.
Patience.
Also written Sabrina, this is a popular girl's name meaning patience.
Like Sabrin, a variation of this name, this is a popular girl's name meaning patience.
Charity for the sake of Allah - not the obligatory charity.

Charity. Often, sadaqah is given out of personal reasons to whomever the giver deems suitable, e.g. a local charity shop. Giving sadaqah is given irrespective of the compulsory taxes and doesn't count as zakat - zakat must be payed irrelevent of the amount spent in sadaqah.

Sadaqah Jariyah means Continuous Alms/Charity. A continuous charity is an action that someone does that remains active even after the person is dead. For example, if a person digs a well then lots of people can use it and for a very long time - even after the person dies. It is a very effective type of charity that serves better than just giving money as the person who initiated the action will get thawab (plus points) even after he dies.
dictionary.more: A popular slogan that explains the concept has been used by different charities in their advert. It goes something like this: "Give a man a fish and he can eat for a day, but give the man a boat and a net to catch fish with then he can feed himself and his family for a life-time.".

dictionary.meaning: Sadiq means truthful. It is a popular boy's name.
The word sa`eed, also incorrectly written 'sayeed', is a popular boys' name. It means happy.
Pure and clear from dirt. Usually this pronoun is applied to innanimate objects like water: Al Maa' al Safi - The pure water.
dictionary.more: You may have been looking for the word 'Tahir'.

dictionary.meaning: Al Sagha'ir means "The Small/Minor Ones". It is usually used in reference to the minor sins that a Muslim should avoid; sins such as name calling, flirting, swearing and other sins.
dictionary.more: The word Sagha'ir comes from Sagheer which means small. The big/major sins are known as the kaba'ir.

dictionary.meaning: Correct.
dictionary.more: The antonym is ghalat or batil.

dictionary.meaning: See Sahabah.

The sahabah (companions)(RA) are all the Muslims who ever met or saw the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). There were many hundreds of sahabah and they were all very different individuals, coming from all walks of life and varied from the least notable ignorant Bedouin to the most appreciated and respected of his devout followers.
dictionary.more:
One of the great misconceptions amongst Muslims is that all the sahabah were good people, but in reality a good deal of them were initially enemies of Islam and the Prophet and many had previously killed Muslims. It is necessary to remember that the sahabah are only human and they still continued to commit sins and some were hypocrites of varying degrees.

Sahabah often have the words 'Radhiallah Anh' (May Allah be Pleased with Him) written after their names, and the acronym form is (RA). But this should not be mentioned after the names of any Sahabi willy-nilly because some of them do not deserve it.

dictionary.meaning: Sahabi means companion, and this label is used to refer to an individual who was a companion of the Prophet Muhammed. Companions of the Prophet Muhammed are shown much respect in Islam.
dictionary.more: The plural word for Sahabi is Sahabah.

dictionary.meaning: This (feminine) word means 'A book'. Sometimes use of this word is meant to refer to the Quran, but it could be any book.
dictionary.more: The usual word for book is kitab.

dictionary.meaning: See Sahih.
Sahib means Friend. It has been used as a boy's name.
Sound/correct/authentic. Used mainly to refer to hadiths and/or the books they were written in.
dictionary.more: The most famous sahih books are Sahih by Bukhari, and Sahih by Muslim. There are 6 recognised sahih books collectivly known as the sihah sitah (six sahihs). These books contain narrations of what Prophet Muhammed (SAW) did or said as well as other details.

dictionary.meaning: A (female) spell caster or witch.
An inadvertent error.
A Sahra` is a desert.
See Suhur.

Saif means sword, and it is a popular boy's name since it refers to titles of certain special people and their bravery in battle. One person to which the name is attributable is Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS) who used a double-pronged sword called thul-fiqar. Ali was titled saif-ullah (Sword of God) by Prophet Muhammed (SAW). Another person the name could fall upon is Khalid bin Waleed, but the title Saif-ullah was given to him by Abu Bakr, the first Khalif (leader) after Muhammed (SAW).
A phrase which is sometimes used as a name or title. It means Sword of Islam.
Saiyaara, also spelled Sayyarah, is the Arabic word for a car.
dictionary.more: Another Arabic word for car is 'arabiyyah.

dictionary.meaning: The word Sajid means 'prostrated (in worshipping God)'. It is a popular boy's name.
dictionary.more: A variation of this name is sajjad.

dictionary.meaning: Sajjad means '(One who) prostrates (in worshipping God)'. It is a popular boy's name.
dictionary.more: A variation of this name is Sajid.

dictionary.meaning: An old and popular Arab girl's name meaning tranquility/peace of mind.

The word salaf means predecessor. In some Islamic literature, the first generation and the two generations that followed after the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) passed away are called al-salaf - the predecessors. Generally, they are considered to be the best generations of Muslims with the majority of the salaf being the Sahabah (or companions) of the Prophet and a few that came after him on the virtue of their faith, actions and their parents having been sahabah.
See Salat.

Salam means "Peace". It is a welcome greeting. It is like saying 'Hi!' - It is the most shortened version of the Islamic greeting (Assalamu Alaikum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh) and originates from the hebrew greeting 'Shalom'.

If someone says Salam to you, you should return the greeting by saying Salam back, or Wa Alaikum As-Salam (and upon you be peace).
dictionary.more:
Abu Hurairah narrated that the Prophet Muhammed (pbuh) said: "Allah created Adam from dust after He mixed the clay and left him for some time until it became sticky mud, after which Allah shaped him. After that Allah left him till it became like potter's clay [a sounding clay]. Iblis used to go past him saying 'You have been created for a great purpose.' After that Allah breathed His spirit into him. The first thing into which the spirit passed was his eye and then his nose. He [Adam] sneezed. Allah said: "May your Lord have mercy upon you, O Adam! Go to those angels and see what they would say.' So Adam went and greeted them. they replied saying: "Peace be upon you and the mercy and blessings of Allah." Allah said: "O Adam! This is your greeting and that of your offspring." (Sahih Bukhari).

This is the origin of saying as-Salamu-Alaykum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuh (peace, mercy and blessings be upon you) when we greet each other; as-Salamu-Alaykum is the shorter verion of this. The Prophet Muhammed (SAW) re-established this wonderful tradition among the Muslims.

dictionary.meaning: Prayer. Usually refering to the 5 daily obligatory prayers.

When a Muslim dies and before they are buried, the male Muslim mourners - family and friends - pray a special standing congressional prayer with the coffin (janazah) in front of them. This special prayer is known as Salat al-Janazah.

Salawat is a name given to a popular Islamic phrase. So a person would say 'salawat' aloud in a congregation and they would all say together "Allahuma Salli ala Muhammed wa ala aali Muhammed" (SAW), which means "May Allah send His praise upon Muhammed and upon the Family of Muhammed". This phrase is a type of prayer (dua).

dictionary.grammar: word; name of prophet; name of male;
dictionary.meaning:
Salih (PBUH) was a Prophet who was mistreated by his people. Allah brought his people a miraculous camel but they broke an agreement not to harm it and they slaughtered the animal. Because of this transgression and other rules they broke, they were destroyed by God.
Salih means rightous, and it is a popular boy's name.
A girl's name meaning happy and content and free from fear.

This phrase is often added after mentioning the name of Prophet Muhammed. It is often represented by the acronym (SAW) or one of its variants. It means 'Allah`s praise and peace be upon him', and it is a means of respect.
Salman is a popular boy's name. Salman al Farsi (RA) was a very respectable companion of Prophet Muhammed (SAW).

(1) A Quail (bird). When the Israelites asked Prophet Moses (PBUH) for food in the desert he prayed to God and he sent them Manna and Quails.
(2) A word and popular girl's name meaning comfort.
Sky or heaven.
Skys or heavens.
dictionary.more:
In the Quran the spelling of this word is different to modern Arabic. In the Quran The Heavens appears like so: السموت
The 'ا' (Alif) character is shown floating above the letters to promote correct pronunciation.

dictionary.meaning: A pronoun meaning 'fat' or 'obese'.
The Arabic word for sand is ramul.
Sarah is a very popular girls' name. Sarah (RA) is the name of Prophet Abraham's (PBUH) first wife.
A boy's name meaning eternity.
The Arabic word for satan is 'Shaitan'.
See Thawab.

Sawm is fasting (refraining from eating, drinking, sex and significant sins). Fasting during the Holy Islamic month of Ramadhan is one of the 5 pillars of Islam. Muslims fast every day in that month from dawn till dusk - effectively ~15 hours - and is not as difficult as people think. After dusk they can eat, drink and have relations.
Fasting is also done outside of this month and is considered a very good form of voluntary worship in devotion to God. A voluntary fast can last as many days as the person wills, but it must not fall on an eid day.
dictionary.more:
Fasting isn't just refraining from food and drink. The purpose of fasting is more spiritual than physical and it is a means of devotion to God as well as self-discipline. Fasting purifies and trains the body and soul together. The Quran speaks about fasting: 
[2.183] O you who believe! fasting is prescribed for you, as it was prescribed for those before you, so that you may guard (against evil).
[2.184] For a certain number of days; but whoever among you is sick or on a journey, then (he shall fast) a (like) number of other days; and those who are not able to do it may effect a redemption by feeding a poor man; so whoever does good spontaneously it is better for him; and that you fast is better for you if you know.
[2.185] The month of Ramazan is that in which the Quran was revealed, a guidance to men and clear proofs of the guidance and the distinction; therefore whoever of you is present in the month, he shall fast therein, and whoever is sick or upon a journey, then (he shall fast) a (like) number of other days; Allah desires ease for you, and He does not desire for you difficulty, and (He desires) that you should complete the number and that you should exalt the greatness of Allah for His having guided you and that you may give thanks.
[2.186] And when My servants ask you concerning Me, then surely I am very near; I answer the prayer of the suppliant when he calls on Me, so they should answer My call and believe in Me that they may walk in the right way.
[2.187] It is made lawful to you to go unto your wives on the night of the fast; they are an apparel for you and you are an apparel for them; Allah knew that you acted unfaithfully to yourselves, so He has turned to you (mercifully) and removed from you (this burden); so now be in contact with them and seek what Allah has ordained for you, and eat and drink until the whiteness of the day becomes distinct from the blackness of the night at dawn, then complete the fast till night, and have not contact with them while you keep to the mosques; these are the limits of Allah, so do not go near them. Thus does Allah make clear His communications for men that they may guard (against evil).

Fasting in Ramadhan is obligatory for every adult male and female except those that will find it difficult like the old, the pregnant/suckling/menstruating woman, the ill, the mentally handicapped, and the traveller. Islam is a very considerate religion and fasting is easy. 
Fasting is very good for the human body as well. It gives the stomach and other organs a rest and alters the blood sugar levels so that excess energy is depleted, and then later renewed. It makes the body lean and the mind open. Fasting is a healthy change to the eating patterns of humans and it is beneficial in many ways.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Sayed means Master or Mr (Mister). Sayed Ali means Mr Ali in most cases. 
(2) It is a noble title as most people who have that title before their name are usually religiously educated or rich (or both). 
(3) The word sayed is also used as a boy's name.
(4) Some Muslims attribute a special meaning to the word sayed - that a person is the descendant of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) through his daughter Fatimah (AS).
See Saif.
The word sayyi' means bad or not good.
See Sayed.
Means 'Our Master'. The na on the end attributes the word master to one's-self.
The Arabic word for Sea is Bahar.
Sehri is a word found and used in a number of East-Asian languagesو especially Urdu, to refer to the Suhur (the Arabic word), a pre-dawn meal eaten by Muslims before the fasting commences.
See Gender.
Heal.

dictionary.grammar: name of female; word; feminine; masculine=shafii;
dictionary.meaning: A (female) intercessor.
A Persian word meaning king.

The Shahadah is a special sentence: La illaha ila Allah wa Muhammadun rasoolollah (There is no (other) Lord except Allah and Muhammed is the Messenger of Allah). This phrase must be pronounced aloud in front of witnesses in order for someone to be initiated as a new Muslim.
A martyr.
dictionary.more: Also see Shahid.

dictionary.meaning: Shahid means 'witness', a person who has or is watching/seeing something. It is a common boy's name.
Shai is Arabic for Tea. It is also written Chai. It is pronounced like the word shy and in some dialects it is pronounced chy.
A devil; a helper or aid to Iblees (Satan) or his cause - whether they be human or jinn.
Tree.
A popular boy's name meaning "Thankful" (to God).
Shalom is the greeting word of the Jews. Muslims use an arabic variation of that word to greet each other - Salam. It means Peace.
Comprehensive.
Shams means Sun. It is also a popular girl's name.
dictionary.more: The correct pronunciation of shams is shems with s for sauce.

dictionary.meaning: Evil.
See Shariah.
A popular boy's name meaning honorable and trustworthy.
A word describing a girl or a name meaning honorable and trustworthy.
An explanation, examination or detailed commentary of something. Sharh al-qur'an means a detailed explanation of the meaning of the qur'an.
Islamic Law concerning the community.
See Shareef.
See Sheikh.
Shayma' is a girl's name whose meaning points out she has a beauty spot (shaymah).

This term is often used in reverence. It can mean:
(1) A Man over 40 years old generally, or
(2) A Muslim knowledgeable in the religion of Islam. Even a new Muslim can be called a Sheikh if he is diligent in seeking the knowledge of Islam based upon the Quran and authentic sources. He is a Sheikh to those he can teach.
(3) Usually a person is known as a Sheikh when they have completed their undergraduate university studies in Islamic studies and are trained in giving lectures.

The word Sheikh is not to be confused with an Alim (scholar).
Associate or partner.
Healing, treatment, or cure.
Shireer means 'wicked' or 'evil'. It is used like so: 'Innahu Shireer' - He is wicked.

Associating false gods with the One, True God, or adding partners in worship with Allah (God). This is a form of Kufur (disbelief in the religion of God), and any person who does this is not a Muslim. A person who commits shirk is a mushrik (polytheist).
Sho'aib is the name of a Prophet (PBUH). It is a popular boy's name and is also spelled 'Shuayb'.
dictionary.more: Prophet Sho'aib was sent to the Midianite people and preached to them about God's oneness and to be fair and just to each other and not cheat in trade but they rejected him and his advice so God punished the Midianites with a deadly earthquake.

dictionary.meaning: A window.
Shuhada' means Martyrs. The singular word is shaheed.
Brave or courageous.
See Shukran.
Thank you.
See Sawm.
See Ill.

Siddeeq (also written Sidiq) means Truthful. It was a title given to a companion of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) called Abu Bakr when he declared that he believed that the Prophet (SAW) had ascended to the 7 heavens in person immediately after hearing about it.
Siddeeqah (also written siddiqah) is the feminine form of the word Siddiq. It means Truthful.
A sidr is a Lote tree found in heaven. Also see Sidratul Muntaha.

A Sidrah is a Lote tree. Muntaha means farthest end or boundary. Sidrat al-Muntaha is a Lote Tree in heaven which marks the highest part of heaven or farthest distance traversable in heaven for most of God's creations. The Prophet Muhammed (SAW) was taken beyond this boundary and communicated with God there.
The number Zero (0) is called Sifr in Arabic.
Simon is an English name meaning 'One who Hears'.

Literally, the sirat means path or road. Islamic teachings use the image of a path to represent the journey from ignorance to enlightenment or sin to piety. It teaches that one must stay on the straight path, follow the correct teachings of Islam and not sin. Sinning and other misguidances are shown as veering off the straight path and becoming misguided and losing one's way in life and not reaching the intended destination. The destination of the path is to God and heaven and not following the path set by God leads to hell.
dictionary.more:
In Islamic theology the sirat also refers to the narrow bridge that crosses over the pits of hell and it must be crossed to enter heaven. Some pious people will easily be able to cross this bridge into heaven while others will find it slippery and treacherous but succeed in crossing it, while others will slip and fall into the fires of hell.

In the Quran, Allah (God) gives us a Surah (Chapter) to recite every day in our prayers. It is called Al-Fatiha, the opening chapter and it mentions the spiritual sirat.

[1.1] In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
[1.2] All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
[1.3] The Beneficent, the Merciful.
[1.4] Master of the Day of Judgement.
[1.5] Thee do we serve and Thee do we beseech for help.
[1.6] Keep us on the right path.
[1.7] The path of those upon whom Thou hast bestowed favours. Not (the path) of those upon whom Thy wrath is brought down, nor of those who go astray.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for sister is 'ukhut'. Muslims call Muslim women sisters as the Muslims are like a large family.
See sawm.
The Arabic word for sky is 'samaa'.
The Arabic word for slave is 'abd'.
Son is ibn in Arabic. To say 'my son' the word is ibni.
dictionary.more: Daughter is bint.

dictionary.meaning: A person who is from the country of Somalia.
The Arabic word for the country of Syria.
The Arabic word for sorry is either '`afwen' or 'Al-`afoo'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for `afwen.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for soul is 'rooh'.
The Arabic word for star is 'najm' (stars) or (singular) 'najmah'.
dictionary.more: The Arabic word shown is for najmah.

dictionary.meaning: See Astaghfirullah.
The Arabic word for strength is quwah.

This phrase is said during the 5 daily prayers in the sujood action. When a worshipper places their head on the earth they say this phrase before they rise back to the sitting position. The meaning of the phrase is '(Most) glorious is the Highest Lord'.
Most glorious. Used in referance to Allah (God) in the phrase: Allah subhanah wa tala. Also written subhanahu.
This phrase means 'Glorious is He and He is exalted' and it is placed after the name of God like so: Allah (SWT), as a sign of reverence. It is often written as an acronym like so (SWT).
A phrase meaninging: "Glory be to Allah (God)". Muslims commonly use this phrase in moments of surprise but it is used by God in the Qur'an to denounce that which people falsely ascribe to him.
dictionary.more: [Qur'an 6.100] And they make the jinn associates with Allah, while He created them, and they falsely attribute to Him sons and daughters without knowledge; glory be to Him, and highly exalted is He above what they ascribe (to Him).

dictionary.meaning: Youngest/Junior or smallest. This is an addition to a name that implies that one sibling is the youngest of the two. For example, Ali ibn Abi Talib (AS) and Fatima bint Muhammad (AS) had two daughters whom they named Zaynab. They named one Zaynab Al-Kubraa (Zaynab Senior) and the other Zaynab Al-Sughraa (Zaynab Junior).

Suhoor, sometimes spelled suhur, is the name of a light meal eaten at night before daylight appears and the period of fasting begins. The Prophet Muhammed (SAW) recommended the believers to observe the suhoor, to wake up before the commencing of fasting and eat and drink to put them in good stead to successfully complete the day's fast. If a Muslim misses the suhur, he or she must still fast that day regardless.
dictionary.more: Suhoor is the name of the meal before fasting begins and futoor is the name of the meal after fasting ends. Muslims fast during daylight hours in the month of Ramadhan and eat before and after the daylight fasting periods.

dictionary.meaning: See Suhoor.
The act of bowing down to Allah in worship. It is a necessary act during salat (worship). The hands, knees, feet and the forehead touch the ground.
See Sujood.
Sulaiman (PBUH) is a Prophet of God, known as Solomon in English. Sulaiman is a popular boy's name.
A person with power and authority - a leader.
The Arabic word for sun is "shams". Shams also happens to be a popular girl's name.
dictionary.more: The correct pronunciation of shams is shems with s for sauce.

dictionary.meaning: A fine silk-like fabric that makes up the clothing of the inhabitants of heaven.
The Sunnah is the ways, teachings and activities of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). Muslims should emulate the sunnah of the Prophet to be good Muslims.
Supplication is 'Dua' in Arabic. This is a form of prayer where an individual opens their hands palms-up in front of them and recites either a pre-formulated written or personal prayer to God.

(1) See Surah.
(2) A picture or image.
dictionary.more: The Arabic form shown is for meaning (1), but the spelling of meaning (2) is like so: صوره.

dictionary.meaning: A Surah is a chapter of the Quran but it is different to what you may understand chapters to be like in normal books. There are 114 surahs in the Quran and they range from being 3 verses to 286 verses in length.
See Surah.
The Arabic word for sweet (nice) is Hilloo. The candy type of sweet is known as Hallawah.
dictionary.more: The Arabic shown is for the nice type of sweet.

dictionary.meaning: Syahm (or siam) is the same as 'sawm'. See Sawm.

Official Name: Syrian Arab Republic.
The Arabic name is Sooryah.
dictionary.more: Capital: Damascus.

dictionary.meaning: Ta'ala means "most high". Used in referance to Allah (God) in the phrase: Allah subhanah wa ta'ala.
Ta'awun means uniting and working together as a group.
The word tabbat means 'perished' or 'destroyed'.
dictionary.more:
A certain incident occurred during the life of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) about 3 years after first receiving revelations from the Angel Gabriel (AS). Muhammed was commanded by God to proclaim the message of Islam publicly, so he walked up a nearby hill near the houses of the Quraish tribe in Makkah and called out to all the people to come.

This raised area was used to warn the towns' people if they were under attack from a nearby tribe or if some other harm was coming their way, so when Muhammed called out to the people he knew they would all be shocked and come running to him to see what was behind the hill.

So they came in a rush and asked him why he had called them. Muhammed asked them 'If I said a large army is about to attack us, then would you believe me?', the people said yes, indeed you are most truthful - we know that you are one of the truthful ones.

Muhammed then explained that there was no such army but he had something important to say, something much more important than an attacking army. Then he began to tell them about the principle beliefs of Islam, of his Prophethood and that he was a Messenger of God sent to stop the people from polytheism and to guide them to the path of the one and only God. The people listened attentively, but not all people took it lightly.

Among the crowd was his uncle Abu Lahab (Father of fire), so called because of his fiery anger and his reddish complexion, and he was very annoyed with what Muhammed had done. He said to Muhammed after listening to the initial few words the Prophet said, 'Is this what you called us out here for?!! May you perish/be destroyed (Tabban laka)'.

Muhammed was surprised by this response and remained silent. God was very angered by the insult and he sent these verses to Muhammed - 
In the Name of Allah Most Gracious Most Merciful
[111.1] Perdition (Tabbat) overtake both hands of Abu Lahab, and he will perish.
[111.2] His wealth and what he earns will not avail him.
[111.3] He shall soon burn in fire that flames,
[111.4] And his wife, the bearer of fuel,
[111.5] Upon her neck a halter of strongly twisted rope.

Abu Lahab was an avowed enemy to Muhammed from the very beginning and so was his wife, hence the curse upon her too.

dictionary.meaning: A tabeeb is a doctor or physician. Arabs call dentists and vets tabeeb too.
Tabi'een means 'followers'.

(1) (Verb) Explaining and understanding a situation or text. 
(2) (Noun) A commentary or explanation of something. Usually, the tafseer (commentary) is of the Qur'an or a verse of the Qur'an.
See Tafseer.

Taha or Ta-Ha is a word formed of two letters - T and H. These two letters form the first verse of the 20th chapter of the Qur'an and the chapter is named Taha accordingly. Taha is said to be one of the names of Prophet Muhammed (SAW).

Tahajjud is the name of a highly mustahab (recommended) prayer that is performed during the night, before the fajr (morning) prayers. This prayer is often called salat al-layl (the night prayer). In Asian countries this prayer is called namaz al-shab.
Ritual purity. The word taharah is derived from the word tahir. Example of use: He was in the state of taharah.
Pure/clean/untouched. It is used to refer to that which is ritually pure. It is also a name used for males.
A crown.

Tajweed is either the act of reciting or the actual medium of a special type of recitation of the Quran. It is a beautiful recitation method that employs all the diacritics and rules of recitation in lengthening, shortening and altering sounds of letters so that it results in a wonderful sounding recitation of the Quran. It takes a long time to complete the Quran with proper tajweed and great skill to do it well.
See Tajweed.
Takalam is an order for someone to speak. Takalami is the feminine form used when speaking to a woman.
Takbeer is saying 'Allah Akbar' - Allah (God) is the Greatest.
See Takbeer.
The action of claiming a person or a group are kafir.
See Takfeer.
See Taqwa.
See Talaq.
Divorce.
Talha is the name of one of the companions of Prophet Muhammed (SAW).
Student or someone who requests a thing. E.g. Talibul Ilm, means Requester of Knowledge.
Tamara is a girl's name which comes from the Arabic word for the date palm fruit, Tamr.
Dates (fruit of the date palm).
A popular boy's name that means shining/brightness. It comes from the word noor, light.
A popular boy's name meaning rightous or pious. The word taqi comes from the word taqwa, piety.
Dissimulation - to conceal, partially conceal or disguise one's true feelings, beliefs or information when there is threat of death or serious harm and when there is a threat of great evil.
dictionary.more: Contrary to popular beliefs, this is not just a tenant of the Shia Islamic sect. All Muslims uphold it and it is logically and ethically necessary. It was practised by the Sahabah (RA), the companions of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW), under threat of death from the pagans.

dictionary.meaning: Taqleed means 'emulation' or 'copying' another individual. In Islam, Muslims do taqleed of a scholar who they believe preaches the correct thing in fiqh (jurisprudence - religious law). They do this by following his opinions concerning fiqh issues.
See Taqleed.

Taqwa is a concept in Islam that is interpreted by some Islamic Scholars as God consciousness. It has many further understandings and interpretations. Taqwa may mean piousness, fear of Allah, love for Allah, and self restraint.
dictionary.more: Having Taqwa allows a person to be constantly aware of both God's presence and attributes and a reminder of their relationship and responsibility to God as His creation and servant. The scholars explain that the way to taqwa is through obedience of God, avoiding disobedience, and striving to stay away from doubtful matters.

dictionary.meaning: This is a prayer that is done by Ahlul Sunnah (Sunni Muslims) during the month of Ramadhan and it is done after the isha prayers and before fajr prayers. It is a voluntary deed of worship. The word taraweeh was not a word that came from the time of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). It was originally identified as Salat al Tahajud.
dictionary.more: Muslims have differences between themselves concerning how many ruku's (bows) are in the prayer, and among some of the Muslims there is disagreement concerning it being considered bida (innovation) to do it in congregation.

dictionary.meaning: A path, way or method.
An old Arab boy's name that means 'one who knocks (the door)'.
See Tawheed.

The Arabic word for Torah. The torah is the first 5 chapters/books (Pentateuch - Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, Deuteronomy) of the Old Testament and it was orignally revealed to Prophet Moses (AS).
The act of going round the Ka'bah seven times. People usually do this during umrah or hajj rituals.
The act of relying upon something or someone - to place faith or confidence in Allah (usually).
Repentance.
Guidance, support or confirmation. Tawfeeq, sometimes written tawfiq, is a popular boy's name meaning guidance from God.
Confirming the Oneness of Allah. It is the basis of Islam.
A peacock.

Tayammum is done when there is no water to perform the usual Islamic rites, or there is difficulties concerning the water. Tayammum is done using dust when there is no water for ablution (wudhu) or ghusl (ritual wash).
dictionary.more:
[Quran 5.6] O you who believe! when you rise up to prayer, wash your faces and your hands as far as the elbows, and wipe your heads and your feet to the ankles; and if you are under an obligation to perform a total ablution, then wash (yourselves) and if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you come from the privy, or you have touched the women, and you cannot find water, betake yourselves to pure earth and wipe your faces and your hands therewith, Allah does not desire to put on you any difficulty, but He wishes to purify you and that He may complete His favor on you, so that you may be grateful.

To do tayammum, you first make the intention, then hit the earth with the palms of both hands together, wipe the forhead with them, starting at the hairline and continuing to the top of the nose and eyebrows. Then, the back of the right hand should be wiped with the left hand from the wrist down to the tips of the fingers. The same should be done to the left hand using the right hand to wipe it.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for tea is Shai (pronounced shy).
The Arabic word for teacher is 'mu`alim'.
dictionary.more: Another word for teacher is ustadh.

dictionary.meaning: The Fig fruit. There is a Surah in the Quran that is known by this name.
The Arabic word for terrorism is Irhab. A terrorist is called an Irhabi.
dictionary.more:
There is no good definition to describe exactly what terrorism is and who it's perpetrators are.

Western media likes to portray terrorism as something linked to the religion of Islam but this is biased because when non-Muslims do acts that are similar they are not labelled terrorists nor do they make the headlines. Also, terrorist organizations around the world vary in political aims, religious beliefs and motivations, but it tends to be the Muslim organizations that are talked about by the media.

Terrorism is absolutely forbidden in Islam and one has to remember that the victims of terrorism are more likely to be Muslim than not.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for test is imtihan.
An old Arab boy's name that means stationary, fixed in one place, or firm.
A tha'leb is a fox.
This word means 'second' or 'another'.
dictionary.more: Also see 'first': Awal;.

dictionary.meaning: Thank you is 'Shukran' in Arabic.
See Thank you.

When a good action or form of worship is done for the sake of God, you get positive points. These points are known as thawab. If you have more positive points (thawab) than negative points (ithim), then you enter heaven. If not, you enter hell. If your thawab and ithim are equal then you will be in limbo.
Robe or dress.
Three (3) is thalathah in Arabic.
An old Arab girl's name meaning star.
Child.
Tilawah, or specifically tilawat al-Qur'an, means recitation of the Qur'an.

The English word 'to' can have multiple uses and is especially fluid in use. In Arabic different words are used to represent it within a sentence based on how the sentence is worded and its meaning.
1. "I went to the show" - to is 'ila' here
2. "To sail in a boat is..." - such a sentence is rarely started the same way as the English sentence, but in this case it can be 'li...' or
3. "To bake a cake you..." - 'hatta' (implies a question was asked).
dictionary.more: The Arabic word shown is the word 'ila'.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for tongue is 'Lisan'.
Toonis (or Tunis) is the Arabic name for the country of Tunisia.
The Arabic word for train is Qittar.
The Arabic word for try is 'hawil'.
Tufayl is the name of a companion of the Prophet Muhammed (SAW). It means infant.
A small earthen/clay tablet that is often moulded into a square or circular shape. Mainly Shia Muslims place their heads on this in sujood (prostration). It is not worshipped.
The phrase "Tusbah 'ala Khair" is the Arabic equivalent of "Good Night". Literally, it means "(I hope you) awaken upon goodness".

dictionary.grammar: name of place; name of war;
dictionary.meaning: The name of a mountain outside of Madinah. It was the setting of the second war between the Muslims and the pagan tribe of Quraish in 3 A.H. The Muslims lost this war.
See Ukhti.
Means 'my sister'. The 'i' on the end changes the attributes of the word ukhut (sister) to be yours.
Means sister. Often the word is appended with an 'i' to be ukhti which means 'my sister'.
Many Alims (Muslim scholars).
Ulema is the plural of Alim.
The phrase "Ulil Azim" roughly translates to The Foremost in Resoluteness, and it is used to describe the five greatest Messengers, Prophets of God: Noah - Abraham - Moses - Jesus - Muhammed (PBUT).
See Umm.

In Islamic history, Umar bin Al Khatab is one of the best known companions of Prophet Muhammed (SAW). Umar became the second Khalif (leader) after the death of the Prophet. Many other famous people in history have been known by the name Umar. Umar is a very popular boy's name, sometimes written Omar.
See Ummi.

(1) Umm means Mother or 'Mother of ...'. For example, 'Umm Ahmed' means Mother of Ahmed. In Arab countries most people are called Umm X, (where X is the name of the first son or daughter,) by people who know them, instead of their official name.
(2) Umm can also mean 'possessor of X', where X can be an attribute or a distinct object. For example the name Umm Kulthoom means 'Possessor of chubby cheeks'.

Also of interest to you may be the word Abu.
dictionary.more: Umm Kulthoom was the nickname of one of the daughters of Imam Ali (AS), the Prophet Muhammed's (SAW) cousin.

dictionary.meaning: 'The mother of her father'. Prophet Muhammed (SAW) titled his daughter Fatimah (AS) this because she looked after him and cared for him so much.
See Ummah.
An ummah is a community or a people. It is used in reference to the community of Believers or Muslims across the globe because they are brothers and sisters in Islam.

(1) Unlettered or illiterate.
(2) Or, an alternative view, the word ummi refers to 'Umm al-Qura', another name the holy City of Makkah is known for. The 'Ummi Prophet' means the Prophet is a citizen of Umm al-Qura.
See Umrah.

Umrah is an Islamic ritual that can be performed at Makkah any time of the year. It is a recommended ritual that is like the Hajj. It includes Tawaf 7 times around the Ka`bah and walking 7 times between the hills of Safa and Marwah.
Undhurna is an old Arabic word which is used to get someone's attention and it literally means grant us some delay or wait for us. It is found in the Qur'an. See Ra'ina for a detailed explanation.
Urdu is a language spoken by people in many countries in Asia, especially in India and Pakistan.
Ascension.
A little lion. This word has been used as a boy's name.
dictionary.more: The word for an adult lion is asad.

dictionary.meaning: This word means Teacher. Another word that means teacher is mualim.
The Arabic word for usury is Ribaa.

Uthman is a popular boys name. Uthman bin Affan was a companion of Prophet Muhammed (SAW) and became the 3rd khalif (leader of the Muslims) after the death of the Prophet. He was later murdered by unknown assailants and this triggered a troubling set of developments in history.
Uzair (Ezra in English) is a Prophet of God. He was sent to the Jews to re-write the bible for them, and to re-guide them to path of righteousness.
See Wali.
Vanessa is an English name meaning 'butterfly'.
dictionary.more: Owing to the Arabic language not having the letter V in its alphabet, the letter faa was used instead and it sounds just like the letter F in English - so it's Fanessa.

dictionary.meaning: The English word 'veil' is correctly identified as the headscarf, the hijab in Arabic.
A verse (often of the Quran) is know as an 'Ayah' in Arabic.
The Arabic word for virgin is '`adhra`'. The mother of Christ (AS),(PBUH), is called Maryam al-`adhra` - The Virgin Mary.

(1) "And", eg. wa lillah mulk al samawat (And with Allah is the dominion of the heavens)
(2) "By", eg. wa-llah ([I swear] by Allah).
When a Muslim is greeted with the word 'salam' or its variants, they should reply Wa Alaikum as-Salam - And upon you be peace.
A deep ditch formed by erosion.
Wadood means loving. One of God's names is 'Al-Wadood' - The Loving (God).
A popular girl's name meaning faithfulness and loyalty.
The death or passing-away of someone. For example people will use this word like: 'Today is the wafat of Prophet Muhammed (SAW)'.
dictionary.more: The common word for death is mawt.

dictionary.meaning: Loyal and faithful.

(1) The numerical value of one (1).
(2) A person.
This is a slang Arabic word used most by Iraqis and it means "Where are you?!".
dictionary.more: The correct phrase is 'Aina ente?'. The Arabic representation shown is the transliteral spelling of the slang word.

dictionary.meaning: See Wejh.
Obligatory, necessary or mandatory.
A representative or agent.
Boy.
Leader, protector, guardian, supporter, helper, friend etc. It is a general word that changes meaning depending on the sentance or situation.
A marriage banquet at the wedding reception.
Waliyullah is composed of two words: wali and Allah. Together they mean 'Leader from Allah' or 'Leader chosen by Allah'.
Wallah or Wallahi means '(I swear) by Allah'. It is used to affirm the conviction of being truthful.
An old Arabic boy's name meaning warrior.
The Arabic word for war is 'harb'.
Flower. This word has been used as a girl's name.
The Arabic word for warm is daffi`.
Handsome. It is a common boy's name.
The word waseemah is the feminine form of the masculine word waseem, which means handsome.
The Arabic word for washing is 'ghusl'.
A written will or testament or word of advice.
See Waseem.
Nation or country.
dictionary.more: If i is added to the end of the word it becomes watani which means My Country.

dictionary.meaning: The Arabic word for water is Ma'.
The word wayyak can be used to warn people in a precautionary manner. It can mean 'be careful of' or it can be used in a more aggressive tone to mean '(may) Woe be unto you (if)...'.
A minister.
See Wazeer.
The Arabic word for wedding is '`iris'.

(1) The value of 1 (one) in Arabic. (feminine)
(2) A (female) person.
Face.
The Arabic word for 'where' is 'aina'.
dictionary.more: The 'a' on the end is a diacritic.

dictionary.meaning: The English word 'white' is abyadh in Arabic.
The Arabic word for 'why' is 'limadha'.
See Evil.
The English word 'wife' is 'zawjah' in Arabic.
Birth or birthday.
The Arabic word for wise is Aziz.
The words and ideas that the devils whisper into a person's heart to tempt them to do sinful things.
dictionary.more:
The word wiswas is found in the Quran in Surat Al Naas (The People).
-In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful-
[114.1] Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of men,
[114.2] The King of men,
[114.3] The God of men,
[114.4] From the evil of the whisperings of the slinking (Shaitan),
[114.5] Who whispers into the hearts of men,
[114.6] From among the jinn and the men.

dictionary.meaning: The plural English word 'wives' is 'zawjat' in Arabic.
See Wudhu.
The Arabic word for women is 'nisaa'.
The Arabic word for world is '`alem'.
The Arabic word for worship is 'Ibadah'. The Arabic word for prayer is 'Salat'.

Wudhu is known as 'ablution' in English. Wudhu is a ceremonial act of washing and wiping the hands, face, arms, head and feet before praying or touching the text of the Quran. Without wudhu those activities would be void and unlawful.
dictionary.more:
In the Name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
[5.6] O you who believe! when you rise up to prayer, wash your faces and your hands as far as the elbows, and wipe your heads and your feet to the ankles; and if you are under an obligation to perform a total ablution (ghusl janabah), then wash (yourselves) and if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you come from the privy, or you have touched the women, and you cannot find water, betake yourselves to pure earth and wipe your faces and your hands therewith, Allah does not desire to put on you any difficulty, but He wishes to purify you and that He may complete His favor on you, so that you may be grateful.

dictionary.meaning: See Wudhu.
See Zeinah.
The word 'Ya' is often followed by another word like Allah, so 'Ya Allah' means 'O God'. Ya can also mean 'you'.
O` Lord or O` God. This phrase is uttered when praying in supplication to Allah, amongst other things.
A Jew.
dictionary.more: A Christian is known as a maseehi.
