dictionary.meaning: Prophet Yahya (PBUH), or John the Baptist is one of the Prophets of Islam. He was the son of Prophet Zakariyah (PBUH), maternal cousin to Maryam (AS), and cousin to Prophet Isa (PBUH). He paved the way for Prophet Isa (Jesus) and also baptised him.
The orientation or direction: right. Yasar means left.

Yantasiroon comes from the word nasr which means victory. Yantasiroon means 'They (shall) have victory (over)'. An example of its usage is 'Innal mu'mineena sawfa yantasiroona ala qawmi-dhalimeen' - The believers shall have victory over the oppressive nation.
Certainty or doubtless conviction.
See Yaqeen.

Jacob (in English), son of Isaac (Ishaq), the Prophet, was also called Israel which means "Servant of Allah." His grandparents, Abraham and Sarah, were given the tidings of his piety and prophethood. Jacob was the father of Joseph (Yusuf). His 12 sons became the progenitors of the tribes of Israel.
Yarhamakallah is a phrase meaning '(may) Allah be gracious towards you'.
An orphan.

The old name of the city of Madinah, Saudia Arabia. When the Prophet Muhammed (SAW) went on the Hijrah (emigration from Makkah) to Yathrib, he arrived there and it was renamed Madinah Al Munawarah - The light-filled city - in his honor.
See Yawm.
(The/A) Day.

dictionary.grammar: noun; 2 words joined by a connector;
dictionary.meaning: The day of resurrection. This is Judgement day.
A yayawar (or yayavar) is a traveller, gypsy or nomad.
dictionary.more: This word has nothing to do with Islam or Muslims.

dictionary.meaning: Hand.
The Arabic word for 'yes' is na'am.
See Yateem.
The Arabic word for 'you' is 'anta' (masculin) or 'enti' (feminine).
See Yusuf.
Jonah in English. He was Allah's messenger to the people of Ninawa to invite them to the worship of the Only True God.
dictionary.more: When they rejected him, he threatened them that punishment would come within three nights. Out of fear of being punished they believed in Allah. Jonah departed his people and later was on board of a sinking ship. After casting lots three times, Jonah was chosen to be thrown in the sea. He was swallowed by a great whale and was disgorged unharmed three days later. He was then sent to more than 100,000 persons calling them to the worship of Allah.

dictionary.meaning: Joseph in English. He was a prophet of God and the favorite son of prophet Jacob. Chapter 12 of the holy Qur'an is named after Joseph and relates his story.
dictionary.more: Once, in a dream, Joseph saw eleven stars and the sun and the moon all bowing down to him. He went to his father and told him about his dream. He was happy, but advised his son not to tell his step brothers about that dream. The brothers envied Joseph for his father loved him much more than any of them. They plotted to throw him in a well, and told his father that he had been killed by a wolf. Then, he was picked up by caravans who sold him to a rich Egyptian for a low price. The Egyptian took care of Joseph, but later Joseph was imprisoned. Later, Joseph was released from prison and was appointed administrator of Egypt's grain storehouses which he managed wisely during the years of famine. During this period, Joseph's brothers came to Egypt seeking grain. Joseph made himself known to them and asked them to bring their family, including his father, to Egypt. They came and bowed down to him as a fulfillment of his first dream.

dictionary.meaning: See Dhabeehah.
The Zaboor is the Arabic word for the original Psalms scripture revealed to Prophet David (Dawood) (PBUH).
A Za'eem is a Leader. This is also a popular boy's name.
See Dhafir.
Luminous. Often the word zahraa is attributed to the daughter of Prophet Muhammed (SAW), Fatima (AS). It is a popular girl's name.
An old but still popular Arab name meaning increase or abundance. Often spelled Zayd.
Zain means good or best. It is also a popular boy's name.
Zainab is an old Arab name. It is a very popular girl's name.
See Zakat.
Prophet Zakariyah (PBUH) looked after Maryam (Mary) (AS), the mother of Prophet Isa (Jesus) (PBUH), when she was a child. Prophet Zakariyah is the father of John the Baptist, Prophet Yahya (PBUH).
An obligatory Islamic tax that is 2.5% of the annual (yearly) sum of all the money a Muslim owns. It goes to charity.
dictionary.more:
Depending on which school of thought a Muslim follows, zakat is not due on all types of wealth and the rate of tax can vary between 2.5% and 20% based on the type of wealth owned.

Poor Muslims are exempt from paying the zakat and a Muslim must have a minimum amount of wealth (nisab) before zakat becomes obligatory to pay.

dictionary.meaning:
(1) Derived from the word zakat, it is a descriptive word meaning pure or purified.
(2) A descriptive word meaning 'sweet/pure/clean smelling'.
Companion or friend.
See Dhameer.
Zamzam is a the name of a sacred water well in Makkah. People who do Hajj drink from the water of this blessed well.
One who has commited Zina - The act of commiting adultary (if married), or fornication (unmarried).

Zaqqum is a type of tree that grows in hell. It's fruit (A-dhari) resembles the heads of devils and its taste is very bitter. The sinners of hell will be in constant hunger and feel compelled to eat from the fruit which tastes horrible and will boil their bellies like boiling water.
dictionary.more:
The Holy Quran, Surah 44 (The Smoke)[44.43] Surely the tree of the Zaqqum,
[44.44] Is the food of the sinful
[44.45] Like dregs of oil; it shall boil in (their) bellies,
[44.46] Like the boiling of hot water.
